     333             : // Returns true if aFrame is an anonymous flex/grid item.

     336             : {
     337           1 :   const nsIAtom* pseudoType = aFrame->StyleContext()->GetPseudo();

     339           1 :          pseudoType == nsCSSAnonBoxes::anonymousGridItem;
     340             : }
     341             : 
     342             : // Returns true if aFrame is a flex/grid container.
     343             : static inline bool
     344           1 : IsFlexOrGridContainer(const nsIFrame* aFrame)
     345             : {
     346           1 :   const nsIAtom* t = aFrame->GetType();
     347           1 :   return t == nsGkAtoms::flexContainerFrame ||
     348           1 :          t == nsGkAtoms::gridContainerFrame;
     349             : }
     350             : 
     351             : // Returns true IFF the given nsIFrame is a nsFlexContainerFrame and
     352             : // represents a -webkit-{inline-}box container. The frame's GetType() result is
     353             : // passed as a separate argument, since in most cases, the caller will have
     354             : // looked it up already, and we'd rather not make redundant calls to the
     355             : // virtual GetType() method.
     356             : static inline bool
     357           1 : IsFlexContainerForLegacyBox(const nsIFrame* aFrame,
     358             :                             const nsIAtom* aFrameType)
     359             : {
     360             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aFrame->GetType() == aFrameType, "wrong aFrameType was passed");
     361           1 :   return aFrameType == nsGkAtoms::flexContainerFrame &&
     362           1 :     aFrame->HasAnyStateBits(NS_STATE_FLEX_IS_LEGACY_WEBKIT_BOX);
     363             : }
     364             : 
     365             : #if DEBUG
     366             : static void
     367             : AssertAnonymousFlexOrGridItemParent(const nsIFrame* aChild,
     368             :                                     const nsIFrame* aParent)
     369             : {
     370             :   MOZ_ASSERT(IsAnonymousFlexOrGridItem(aChild),

     377             :                "of flex container frames");

     383             : }

     388             : static inline nsContainerFrame*
     389           1 : GetFieldSetBlockFrame(nsIFrame* aFieldsetFrame)

     394           1 :   return inner ? inner->GetContentInsertionFrame() : nullptr;
     395             : }
     396             : 
     397             : #define FCDATA_DECL(_flags, _func)                            \
     398             :   { _flags, { (FrameCreationFunc)_func }, nullptr, nullptr }
     399             : #define FCDATA_WITH_WRAPPING_BLOCK(_flags, _func, _anon_box)  \
     400             :   { _flags | FCDATA_CREATE_BLOCK_WRAPPER_FOR_ALL_KIDS,        \
     401             :       { (FrameCreationFunc)_func }, nullptr, &_anon_box }
     402             : 
     403             : #define UNREACHABLE_FCDATA()                                  \
     404             :   { 0, { (FrameCreationFunc)nullptr }, nullptr, nullptr }
     405             : //----------------------------------------------------------------------
     406             : 
     407             : /**
     408             :  * True if aFrame is an actual inline frame in the sense of non-replaced
     409             :  * display:inline CSS boxes.  In other words, it can be affected by {ib}
     410             :  * splitting and can contain first-letter frames.  Basically, this is either an
     411             :  * inline frame (positioned or otherwise) or an line frame (this last because
     412             :  * it can contain first-letter and because inserting blocks in the middle of it
     413             :  * needs to terminate it).
     414             :  */
     415             : static bool
     416           1 : IsInlineFrame(const nsIFrame* aFrame)
     417             : {
     418           1 :   return aFrame->IsFrameOfType(nsIFrame::eLineParticipant);
     419             : }
     420             : 
     421             : /**
     422             :  * True if aFrame is an instance of an SVG frame class or is an inline/block
     423             :  * frame being used for SVG text.
     424             :  */
     425             : static bool
     426           1 : IsFrameForSVG(const nsIFrame* aFrame)
     427             : {
     428           1 :   return aFrame->IsFrameOfType(nsIFrame::eSVG) ||
     429           1 :          nsSVGUtils::IsInSVGTextSubtree(aFrame);
     430             : }
     431             : 
     432             : /**
     433             :  * Returns true iff aFrame explicitly prevents its descendants from floating
     434             :  * (at least, down to the level of descendants which themselves are
     435             :  * float-containing blocks -- those will manage the floating status of any
     436             :  * lower-level descendents inside them, of course).
     437             :  */
     438             : static bool
     439           1 : ShouldSuppressFloatingOfDescendants(nsIFrame* aFrame)
     440             : {
     441           1 :   return aFrame->IsFrameOfType(nsIFrame::eMathML) ||
     442           1 :     aFrame->IsXULBoxFrame() ||
     443           1 :     ::IsFlexOrGridContainer(aFrame);
     444             : }
     445             : 
     446             : /**
     447             :  * If any children require a block parent, return the first such child.
     448             :  * Otherwise return null.
     449             :  */
     450             : static nsIContent*
     451           1 : AnyKidsNeedBlockParent(nsIFrame *aFrameList)
     452             : {
     453           1 :   for (nsIFrame *k = aFrameList; k; k = k->GetNextSibling()) {
     454             :     // Line participants, such as text and inline frames, can't be
     455             :     // directly inside a XUL box; they must be wrapped in an
     456             :     // intermediate block.
     457           1 :     if (k->IsFrameOfType(nsIFrame::eLineParticipant)) {
     458           1 :       return k->GetContent();
     459             :     }
     460             :   }
     461             :   return nullptr;
     462             : }
     463             : 
     464             : // Reparent a frame into a wrapper frame that is a child of its old parent.
     465             : static void
     466           1 : ReparentFrame(RestyleManager* aRestyleManager,
     467             :               nsContainerFrame* aNewParentFrame,
     468             :               nsIFrame* aFrame)
     469             : {
     470           1 :   aFrame->SetParent(aNewParentFrame);
     471           1 :   aRestyleManager->ReparentStyleContext(aFrame);
     472           1 : }
     473             : 
     474             : static void
     475           1 : ReparentFrames(nsCSSFrameConstructor* aFrameConstructor,
     476             :                nsContainerFrame* aNewParentFrame,
     477             :                const nsFrameList& aFrameList)
     478             : {
     479           1 :   RestyleManager* restyleManager = aFrameConstructor->RestyleManager();
     480           1 :   for (nsFrameList::Enumerator e(aFrameList); !e.AtEnd(); e.Next()) {
     481           1 :     ReparentFrame(restyleManager, aNewParentFrame, e.get());
     482             :   }
     483           1 : }
     484             : 
     485             : //----------------------------------------------------------------------
     486             : //
     487             : // When inline frames get weird and have block frames in them, we
     488             : // annotate them to help us respond to incremental content changes
     489             : // more easily.
     490             : 
     491             : static inline bool
     492             : IsFramePartOfIBSplit(nsIFrame* aFrame)
     493             : {
     494           1 :   return (aFrame->GetStateBits() & NS_FRAME_PART_OF_IBSPLIT) != 0;
     495             : }
     496             : 
     497           1 : static nsContainerFrame* GetIBSplitSibling(nsIFrame* aFrame)
     498             : {
     499             :   NS_PRECONDITION(IsFramePartOfIBSplit(aFrame), "Shouldn't call this");
     500             : 
     501             :   // We only store the "ib-split sibling" annotation with the first
     502             :   // frame in the continuation chain. Walk back to find that frame now.
     503             :   return static_cast<nsContainerFrame*>
     504           1 :     (aFrame->FirstContinuation()->
     505           1 :        Properties().Get(nsIFrame::IBSplitSibling()));
     506             : }
     507             : 
     508           1 : static nsContainerFrame* GetIBSplitPrevSibling(nsIFrame* aFrame)
     509             : {

     513             :   // frame in the continuation chain. Walk back to find that frame now.
     514             :   return static_cast<nsContainerFrame*>

     516           1 :        Properties().Get(nsIFrame::IBSplitPrevSibling()));
     517             : }

     595           1 :   return parentFrame;
     596             : }
     597             : 
     598             : //----------------------------------------------------------------------
     599             : 
     600             : // Block/inline frame construction logic. We maintain a few invariants here:
     601             : //
     602             : // 1. Block frames contain block and inline frames.
     603             : //
     604             : // 2. Inline frames only contain inline frames. If an inline parent has a block
     605             : // child then the block child is migrated upward until it lands in a block
     606             : // parent (the inline frames containing block is where it will end up).
     607             : 
     608             : // After this function returns, aLink is pointing to the first link at or
     609             : // after its starting position for which the next frame is a block.  If there
     610             : // is no such link, it points to the end of the list.
     611             : static void
     612           1 : FindFirstBlock(nsFrameList::FrameLinkEnumerator& aLink)
     613             : {
     614           1 :   for ( ; !aLink.AtEnd(); aLink.Next()) {
     615           1 :     if (!aLink.NextFrame()->IsInlineOutside()) {
     616           1 :       return;
     617             :     }
     618             :   }
     619             : }
     620             : 
     621             : // This function returns a frame link enumerator pointing to the first link in
     622             : // the list for which the next frame is not block.  If there is no such link,
     623             : // it points to the end of the list.
     624             : static nsFrameList::FrameLinkEnumerator
     625           1 : FindFirstNonBlock(const nsFrameList& aList)
     626             : {
     627             :   nsFrameList::FrameLinkEnumerator link(aList);
     628           1 :   for (; !link.AtEnd(); link.Next()) {
     629           1 :     if (link.NextFrame()->IsInlineOutside()) {
     630             :       break;
     631             :     }
     632             :   }
     633           1 :   return link;
     634             : }
     635             : 
     636             : inline void
     637           1 : SetInitialSingleChild(nsContainerFrame* aParent, nsIFrame* aFrame)
     638             : {
     639             :   NS_PRECONDITION(!aFrame->GetNextSibling(), "Should be using a frame list");

     641           1 :   aParent->SetInitialChildList(kPrincipalList, temp);
     642           1 : }

     756             : // Structure used for maintaining state information during the
     757             : // frame construction process
     758             : class MOZ_STACK_CLASS nsFrameConstructorState {
     759             : public:
     760             :   typedef nsIFrame::ChildListID ChildListID;
     761             : 
     762             :   nsPresContext            *mPresContext;
     763             :   nsIPresShell             *mPresShell;

     765             : 
     766             : #ifdef MOZ_XUL
     767             :   // Frames destined for the kPopupList.
     768             :   nsAbsoluteItems           mPopupItems;
     769             : #endif
     770             : 
     771             :   // Containing block information for out-of-flow frames.
     772             :   nsAbsoluteItems           mFixedItems;
     773             :   nsAbsoluteItems           mAbsoluteItems;
     774             :   nsAbsoluteItems           mFloatedItems;
     775             :   // The containing block of a frame in the top layer is defined by the
     776             :   // spec: fixed-positioned frames are children of the viewport frame,
     777             :   // and absolutely-positioned frames are children of the initial
     778             :   // containing block. They would not be caught by any other containing
     779             :   // block, e.g. frames with transform or filter.
     780             :   nsAbsoluteItems           mTopLayerFixedItems;
     781             :   nsAbsoluteItems           mTopLayerAbsoluteItems;
     782             : 
     783             :   nsCOMPtr<nsILayoutHistoryState> mFrameState;
     784             :   // These bits will be added to the state bits of any frame we construct
     785             :   // using this state.
     786             :   nsFrameState              mAdditionalStateBits;
     787             : 
     788             :   // When working with the transform and filter properties, we want to hook
     789             :   // the abs-pos and fixed-pos lists together, since such
     790             :   // elements are fixed-pos containing blocks.  This flag determines
     791             :   // whether or not we want to wire the fixed-pos and abs-pos lists
     792             :   // together.
     793             :   bool                      mFixedPosIsAbsPos;
     794             : 
     795             :   // A boolean to indicate whether we have a "pending" popupgroup.  That is, we
     796             :   // have already created the FrameConstructionItem for the root popupgroup but
     797             :   // we have not yet created the relevant frame.
     798             :   bool                      mHavePendingPopupgroup;
     799             : 
     800             :   // If false (which is the default) then call SetPrimaryFrame() as needed
     801             :   // during frame construction.  If true, don't make any SetPrimaryFrame()
     802             :   // calls, except for generated content which doesn't have a primary frame
     803             :   // yet.  The mCreatingExtraFrames == true mode is meant to be used for
     804             :   // construction of random "extra" frames for elements via normal frame
     805             :   // construction APIs (e.g. replication of things across pages in paginated
     806             :   // mode).
     807             :   bool                      mCreatingExtraFrames;
     808             : 
     809             :   nsCOMArray<nsIContent>    mGeneratedTextNodesWithInitializer;
     810             : 
     811             :   TreeMatchContext&         mTreeMatchContext;

    1127             :   // If there is no container for a fixed, absolute, or floating root
    1128             :   // frame, we will ignore the positioning.  This hack is originally
    1129             :   // brought to you by the letter T: tables, since other roots don't
    1130             :   // even call into this code.  See bug 178855.
    1131             :   //
    1132             :   // XXX Disabling positioning in this case is a hack.  If one was so inclined,
    1133             :   // one could support this either by (1) inserting a dummy block between the
    1134             :   // table and the canvas or (2) teaching the canvas how to reflow positioned
    1135             :   // elements. (1) has the usual problems when multiple frames share the same
    1136             :   // content (notice all the special cases in this file dealing with inner
    1137             :   // tables and table wrappers which share the same content). (2) requires some

    1141             :   // float to "none"?  That's OK per CSS 2.1, as far as I can tell.

    1325           1 : nsFrameConstructorState::ProcessFrameInsertions(nsAbsoluteItems& aFrameItems,

    1346           1 :   if (aFrameItems.IsEmpty()) {
    1347           1 :     return;

    1357             :     // it has abs-pos children instead of fixed-pos children.
    1358           1 :     aChildListID = containingBlock->GetAbsoluteListID();

    1360             :

    1363             :   // is set) and doesn't have any frames in the aChildListID child list yet.

    1374             :     }

    1376           1 :              aChildListID == nsIFrame::kAbsoluteList) {

    1378             :     // append the frame items to the list directly.
    1379           1 :     mFrameManager->AppendFrames(containingBlock, aChildListID, aFrameItems);
    1380             :   } else {
    1381             :     // Note that whether the frame construction context is doing an append or
    1382             :     // not is not helpful here, since it could be appending to some frame in
    1383             :     // the middle of the document, which means we're not necessarily
    1384             :     // appending to the children of the containing block.
    1385             :     //
    1386             :     // We need to make sure the 'append to the end of document' case is fast.
    1387             :     // So first test the last child of the containing block
    1388           1 :     nsIFrame* lastChild = childList.LastChild();
    1389             : 
    1390             :     // CompareTreePosition uses placeholder hierarchy for out of flow frames,
    1391             :     // so this will make out-of-flows respect the ordering of placeholders,
    1392             :     // which is great because it takes care of anonymous content.
    1393           1 :     nsIFrame* firstNewFrame = aFrameItems.FirstChild();
    1394             : 
    1395             :     // Cache the ancestor chain so that we can reuse it if needed.
    1396           1 :     AutoTArray<nsIFrame*, 20> firstNewFrameAncestors;
    1397           1 :     nsIFrame* notCommonAncestor = nullptr;
    1398           1 :     if (lastChild) {
    1399             :       notCommonAncestor = nsLayoutUtils::FillAncestors(firstNewFrame,
    1400             :                                                        containingBlock,
    1401           1 :                                                        &firstNewFrameAncestors);
    1402             :     }
    1403             : 
    1404           1 :     if (!lastChild ||
    1405             :         nsLayoutUtils::CompareTreePosition(lastChild, firstNewFrame,
    1406             :                                            firstNewFrameAncestors,
    1407             :                                            notCommonAncestor ?
    1408           1 :                                              containingBlock : nullptr) < 0) {
    1409             :       // no lastChild, or lastChild comes before the new children, so just append
    1410           1 :       mFrameManager->AppendFrames(containingBlock, aChildListID, aFrameItems);
    1411             :     } else {
    1412             :       // Try the other children. First collect them to an array so that a
    1413             :       // reasonable fast binary search can be used to find the insertion point.
    1414           1 :       AutoTArray<nsIFrame*, 128> children;
    1415           1 :       for (nsIFrame* f = childList.FirstChild(); f != lastChild;
    1416           1 :            f = f->GetNextSibling()) {
    1417           1 :         children.AppendElement(f);
    1418             :       }
    1419             : 
    1420           1 :       nsIFrame* insertionPoint = nullptr;
    1421           1 :       int32_t imin = 0;
    1422           1 :       int32_t max = children.Length();
    1423           1 :       while (max > imin) {
    1424           1 :         int32_t imid = imin + ((max - imin) / 2);
    1425           1 :         nsIFrame* f = children[imid];
    1426             :         int32_t compare =
    1427             :           nsLayoutUtils::CompareTreePosition(f, firstNewFrame, firstNewFrameAncestors,
    1428           1 :                                              notCommonAncestor ? containingBlock : nullptr);

    1430             :           // f is after the new frame.
    1431           1 :           max = imid;
    1432           1 :           insertionPoint = imid > 0 ? children[imid - 1] : nullptr;
    1433           1 :         } else if (compare < 0) {
    1434             :           // f is before the new frame.
    1435           1 :           imin = imid + 1;
    1436           1 :           insertionPoint = f;
    1437             :         } else {
    1438             :           // This is for the old behavior. Should be removed once it is
    1439             :           // guaranteed that CompareTreePosition can't return 0!
    1440             :           // See bug 928645.
    1441             :           NS_WARNING("Something odd happening???");
    1442             :           insertionPoint = nullptr;
    1443           0 :           for (uint32_t i = 0; i < children.Length(); ++i) {
    1444           0 :             nsIFrame* f = children[i];

    1446             :                                                    firstNewFrameAncestors,
    1447             :                                                    notCommonAncestor ?
    1448           0 :                                                      containingBlock : nullptr) > 0) {
    1449             :               break;
    1450             :             }
    1451           0 :             insertionPoint = f;
    1452             :           }
    1453             :           break;
    1454             :         }
    1455             :       }
    1456             :       mFrameManager->InsertFrames(containingBlock, aChildListID,
    1457           1 :                                   insertionPoint, aFrameItems);
    1458             :     }
    1459             :   }
    1460             : 
    1461             :   NS_POSTCONDITION(aFrameItems.IsEmpty(), "How did that happen?");
    1462             : }

    1475           1 : nsFrameConstructorSaveState::~nsFrameConstructorSaveState()
    1476             : {
    1477             :   // Restore the state
    1478           1 :   if (mItems) {
    1479             :     NS_ASSERTION(mState, "Can't have mItems set without having a state!");

    1481           1 :     *mItems = mSavedItems;

    1484             :     // Note that this only matters for the assert in ~nsAbsoluteItems.
    1485             :     mSavedItems.Clear();
    1486             : #endif
    1487           1 :     if (mItems == &mState->mAbsoluteItems) {
    1488           1 :       mState->mFixedPosIsAbsPos = mSavedFixedPosIsAbsPos;
    1489           1 :       if (mSavedFixedPosIsAbsPos) {
    1490             :         // mAbsoluteItems was moved to mFixedItems, so move mFixedItems back
    1491             :         // and repair the old mFixedItems now.
    1492           1 :         mState->mAbsoluteItems = mState->mFixedItems;
    1493           1 :         mState->mFixedItems = mSavedFixedItems;
    1494             : #ifdef DEBUG
    1495             :         mSavedFixedItems.Clear();
    1496             : #endif
    1497             :       }
    1498             :     }
    1499             :     NS_ASSERTION(!mItems->LastChild() || !mItems->LastChild()->GetNextSibling(),
    1500             :                  "Something corrupted our list");
    1501             :   }
    1502           1 : }
    1503             : 
    1504             : /**
    1505             :  * Moves aFrameList from aOldParent to aNewParent.  This updates the parent
    1506             :  * pointer of the frames in the list, and reparents their views as needed.
    1507             :  * nsFrame::SetParent sets the NS_FRAME_HAS_VIEW bit on aNewParent and its
    1508             :  * ancestors as needed. Then it sets the list as the initial child list
    1509             :  * on aNewParent, unless aNewParent either already has kids or has been
    1510             :  * reflowed; in that case it appends the new frames.  Note that this
    1511             :  * method differs from ReparentFrames in that it doesn't change the kids'
    1512             :  * style contexts.
    1513             :  */
    1514             : // XXXbz Since this is only used for {ib} splits, could we just copy the view
    1515             : // bits from aOldParent to aNewParent and then use the
    1516             : // nsFrameList::ApplySetParent?  That would still leave us doing two passes
    1517             : // over the list, of course; if we really wanted to we could factor out the
    1518             : // relevant part of ReparentFrameViewList, I suppose...  Or just get rid of
    1519             : // views, which would make most of this function go away.
    1520             : static void
    1521           1 : MoveChildrenTo(nsIFrame* aOldParent,
    1522             :                nsContainerFrame* aNewParent,
    1523             :                nsFrameList& aFrameList)
    1524             : {
    1525           1 :   bool sameGrandParent = aOldParent->GetParent() == aNewParent->GetParent();
    1526             : 
    1527           1 :   if (aNewParent->HasView() || aOldParent->HasView() || !sameGrandParent) {
    1528             :     // Move the frames into the new view
    1529           0 :     nsContainerFrame::ReparentFrameViewList(aFrameList, aOldParent, aNewParent);
    1530             :   }
    1531             : 
    1532           1 :   for (nsFrameList::Enumerator e(aFrameList); !e.AtEnd(); e.Next()) {
    1533           1 :     e.get()->SetParent(aNewParent);
    1534             :   }
    1535             : 
    1536           1 :   if (aNewParent->PrincipalChildList().IsEmpty() &&
    1537           1 :       (aNewParent->GetStateBits() & NS_FRAME_FIRST_REFLOW)) {
    1538           1 :     aNewParent->SetInitialChildList(kPrincipalList, aFrameList);
    1539             :   } else {
    1540           0 :     aNewParent->AppendFrames(kPrincipalList, aFrameList);
    1541             :   }
    1542           1 : }

    1812             : 
    1813             : /*
    1814             :  * aParentFrame - the frame that should be the parent of the generated
    1815             :  *   content.  This is the frame for the corresponding content node,
    1816             :  *   which must not be a leaf frame.
    1817             :  *
    1818             :  * Any items created are added to aItems.
    1819             :  *
    1820             :  * We create an XML element (tag _moz_generated_content_before or
    1821             :  * _moz_generated_content_after) representing the pseudoelement. We
    1822             :  * create a DOM node for each 'content' item and make those nodes the
    1823             :  * children of the XML element. Then we create a frame subtree for
    1824             :  * the XML element as if it were a regular child of
    1825             :  * aParentFrame/aParentContent, giving the XML element the ::before or
    1826             :  * ::after style.
    1827             :  */
    1828             : void
    1829           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::CreateGeneratedContentItem(nsFrameConstructorState& aState,
    1830             :                                                   nsContainerFrame* aParentFrame,
    1831             :                                                   nsIContent*      aParentContent,

    1835             : {
    1836             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aPseudoElement == CSSPseudoElementType::before ||
    1837             :              aPseudoElement == CSSPseudoElementType::after,
    1838             :              "unexpected aPseudoElement");
    1839             : 
    1840             :   // XXXbz is this ever true?
    1841           1 :   if (!aParentContent->IsElement()) {
    1842             :     NS_ERROR("Bogus generated content parent");

    1844             :   }

    1928             : /****************************************************
    1929             :  **  BEGIN TABLE SECTION
    1930             :  ****************************************************/
    1931             : 
    1932             : // The term pseudo frame is being used instead of anonymous frame, since anonymous
    1933             : // frame has been used elsewhere to refer to frames that have generated content
    1934             : 
    1935             : // Return whether the given frame is a table pseudo-frame. Note that
    1936             : // cell-content and table-outer frames have pseudo-types, but are always
    1937             : // created, even for non-anonymous cells and tables respectively.  So for those
    1938             : // we have to examine the cell or table frame to see whether it's a pseudo
    1939             : // frame. In particular, a lone table caption will have a table wrapper as its
    1940             : // parent, but will also trigger construction of an empty inner table, which
    1941             : // will be the one we can examine to see whether the wrapper was a pseudo-frame.
    1942             : static bool
    1943           1 : IsTablePseudo(nsIFrame* aFrame)
    1944             : {
    1945           1 :   nsIAtom* pseudoType = aFrame->StyleContext()->GetPseudo();
    1946           1 :   return pseudoType &&
    1947           1 :     (pseudoType == nsCSSAnonBoxes::table ||
    1948           1 :      pseudoType == nsCSSAnonBoxes::inlineTable ||
    1949           1 :      pseudoType == nsCSSAnonBoxes::tableColGroup ||
    1950           1 :      pseudoType == nsCSSAnonBoxes::tableRowGroup ||
    1951           1 :      pseudoType == nsCSSAnonBoxes::tableRow ||
    1952           1 :      pseudoType == nsCSSAnonBoxes::tableCell ||
    1953           1 :      (pseudoType == nsCSSAnonBoxes::cellContent &&
    1954           1 :       aFrame->GetParent()->StyleContext()->GetPseudo() ==
    1955           1 :         nsCSSAnonBoxes::tableCell) ||
    1956           1 :      (pseudoType == nsCSSAnonBoxes::tableWrapper &&
    1957           1 :       (aFrame->PrincipalChildList().FirstChild()->StyleContext()->GetPseudo() ==
    1958           1 :          nsCSSAnonBoxes::table ||
    1959           1 :        aFrame->PrincipalChildList().FirstChild()->StyleContext()->GetPseudo() ==
    1960           1 :          nsCSSAnonBoxes::inlineTable)));
    1961             : }
    1962             : 
    1963             : static bool
    1964           1 : IsRubyPseudo(nsIFrame* aFrame)
    1965             : {
    1966           1 :   return RubyUtils::IsRubyPseudo(aFrame->StyleContext()->GetPseudo());
    1967             : }
    1968             : 
    1969             : static bool
    1970           1 : IsTableOrRubyPseudo(nsIFrame* aFrame)
    1971             : {
    1972           1 :   return IsTablePseudo(aFrame) || IsRubyPseudo(aFrame);
    1973             : }
    1974             : 
    1975             : /* static */
    1976             : nsCSSFrameConstructor::ParentType
    1977           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::GetParentType(nsIAtom* aFrameType)
    1978             : {
    1979           1 :   if (aFrameType == nsGkAtoms::tableFrame) {
    1980             :     return eTypeTable;

    2285             :   nsContainerFrame* newFrame;
    2286             :   // <mtable> is border separate in mathml.css and the MathML code doesn't implement
    2287             :   // border collapse. For those users who style <mtable> with border collapse,
    2288             :   // give them the default non-MathML table frames that understand border collapse.
    2289             :   // This won't break us because MathML table frames are all subclasses of the default
    2290             :   // table code, and so we can freely mix <mtable> with <mtr> or <tr>, <mtd> or <td>.
    2291             :   // What will happen is just that non-MathML frames won't understand MathML attributes
    2292             :   // and will therefore miss the special handling that the MathML code does.
    2293           1 :   if (kNameSpaceID_MathML == nameSpaceID && !tableFrame->IsBorderCollapse()) {

    2361             : static inline bool
    2362           1 : NeedFrameFor(const nsFrameConstructorState& aState,
    2363             :              nsIFrame*   aParentFrame,
    2364             :              nsIContent* aChildContent)
    2365             : {
    2366             :   // XXX the GetContent() != aChildContent check is needed due to bug 135040.
    2367             :   // Remove it once that's fixed.
    2368             :   NS_PRECONDITION(!aChildContent->GetPrimaryFrame() ||
    2369             :                   aState.mCreatingExtraFrames ||
    2370             :                   aChildContent->GetPrimaryFrame()->GetContent() != aChildContent,
    2371             :                   "Why did we get called?");
    2372             : 
    2373             :   // don't create a whitespace frame if aParentFrame doesn't want it.
    2374             :   // always create frames for children in generated content. counter(),
    2375             :   // quotes, and attr() content can easily change dynamically and we don't
    2376             :   // want to be reconstructing frames. It's not even clear that these
    2377             :   // should be considered ignorable just because they evaluate to
    2378             :   // whitespace.
    2379             : 
    2380             :   // We could handle all this in CreateNeededPseudoContainers or some other
    2381             :   // place after we build our frame construction items, but that would involve
    2382             :   // creating frame construction items for whitespace kids of
    2383             :   // eExcludesIgnorableWhitespace frames, where we know we'll be dropping them
    2384             :   // all anyway, and involve an extra walk down the frame construction item
    2385             :   // list.
    2386           1 :   if ((aParentFrame &&
    2387           1 :        (!aParentFrame->IsFrameOfType(nsIFrame::eExcludesIgnorableWhitespace) ||
    2388           1 :         aParentFrame->IsGeneratedContentFrame())) ||
    2389           1 :       !aChildContent->IsNodeOfType(nsINode::eTEXT)) {
    2390             :     return true;
    2391             :   }
    2392             : 
    2393             :   aChildContent->SetFlags(NS_CREATE_FRAME_IF_NON_WHITESPACE |
    2394           1 :                           NS_REFRAME_IF_WHITESPACE);
    2395           1 :   return !aChildContent->TextIsOnlyWhitespace();
    2396             : }

    2447             :   // the future.  We need this, because the document element might
    2448             :   // have stale restyle bits from a previous frame constructor for
    2449             :   // this document.  Unlike in AddFrameConstructionItems, it's safe to
    2450             :   // unset all element restyle flags, since we don't have any
    2451             :   // siblings.
    2452           1 :   aDocElement->UnsetRestyleFlagsIfGecko();

    2705             : 
    2706             : 
    2707             : nsIFrame*
    2708           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::ConstructRootFrame()
    2709             : {
    2710             :   AUTO_LAYOUT_PHASE_ENTRY_POINT(mPresShell->GetPresContext(), FrameC);
    2711             : 
    2712           1 :   StyleSetHandle styleSet = mPresShell->StyleSet();
    2713             : 
    2714             :   // Set up our style rule observer.

    2749             : }
    2750             : 
    2751             : void
    2752           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::SetUpDocElementContainingBlock(nsIContent* aDocElement)
    2753             : {
    2754             :   NS_PRECONDITION(aDocElement, "No element?");
    2755             :   NS_PRECONDITION(!aDocElement->GetParent(), "Not root content?");
    2756             :   NS_PRECONDITION(aDocElement->GetUncomposedDoc(), "Not in a document?");
    2757             :   NS_PRECONDITION(aDocElement->GetUncomposedDoc()->GetRootElement() ==
    2758             :                   aDocElement, "Not the root of the document?");
    2759             : 
    2760             :   /*
    2761             :     how the root frame hierarchy should look
    2762             : 
    2763             :   Galley presentation, non-XUL, with scrolling:
    2764             : 
    2765             :       ViewportFrame [fixed-cb]
    2766             :         nsHTMLScrollFrame
    2767             :           nsCanvasFrame [abs-cb]
    2768             :             root element frame (nsBlockFrame, nsSVGOuterSVGFrame,
    2769             :                                 nsTableWrapperFrame, nsPlaceholderFrame)
    2770             : 
    2771             :   Galley presentation, XUL
    2772             : 
    2773             :       ViewportFrame [fixed-cb]
    2774             :         nsRootBoxFrame
    2775             :           root element frame (nsDocElementBoxFrame)
    2776             : 
    2777             :   Print presentation, non-XUL
    2778             : 
    2779             :       ViewportFrame
    2780             :         nsSimplePageSequenceFrame
    2781             :           nsPageFrame
    2782             :             nsPageContentFrame [fixed-cb]
    2783             :               nsCanvasFrame [abs-cb]
    2784             :                 root element frame (nsBlockFrame, nsSVGOuterSVGFrame,
    2785             :                                     nsTableWrapperFrame, nsPlaceholderFrame)
    2786             : 
    2787             :   Print-preview presentation, non-XUL
    2788             : 
    2789             :       ViewportFrame
    2790             :         nsHTMLScrollFrame
    2791             :           nsSimplePageSequenceFrame
    2792             :             nsPageFrame
    2793             :               nsPageContentFrame [fixed-cb]
    2794             :                 nsCanvasFrame [abs-cb]
    2795             :                   root element frame (nsBlockFrame, nsSVGOuterSVGFrame,
    2796             :                                       nsTableWrapperFrame, nsPlaceholderFrame)
    2797             : 
    2798             :   Print/print preview of XUL is not supported.
    2799             :   [fixed-cb]: the default containing block for fixed-pos content
    2800             :   [abs-cb]: the default containing block for abs-pos content
    2801             : 
    2802             :   Meaning of nsCSSFrameConstructor fields:
    2803             :     mRootElementFrame is "root element frame".  This is the primary frame for
    2804             :       the root element.
    2805             :     mDocElementContainingBlock is the parent of mRootElementFrame
    2806             :       (i.e. nsCanvasFrame or nsRootBoxFrame)
    2807             : 
    2808             :     mPageSequenceFrame is the nsSimplePageSequenceFrame, or null if there isn't one
    2809             :   */
    2810             : 
    2811             :   // --------- CREATE ROOT FRAME -------
    2812             : 
    2813             : 
    2814             :   // Create the root frame. The document element's frame is a child of the
    2815             :   // root frame.
    2816             :   //
    2817             :   // The root frame serves two purposes:
    2818             :   // - reserves space for any margins needed for the document element's frame
    2819             :   // - renders the document element's background. This ensures the background covers
    2820             :   //   the entire canvas as specified by the CSS2 spec
    2821             : 
    2822           1 :   nsPresContext* presContext = mPresShell->GetPresContext();
    2823           1 :   bool isPaginated = presContext->IsRootPaginatedDocument();
    2824           1 :   nsContainerFrame* viewportFrame = static_cast<nsContainerFrame*>(GetRootFrame());
    2825           1 :   nsStyleContext* viewportPseudoStyle = viewportFrame->StyleContext();
    2826             : 
    2827           1 :   nsContainerFrame* rootFrame = nullptr;
    2828             :   nsIAtom* rootPseudo;
    2829             : 
    2830           1 :   if (!isPaginated) {
    2831             : #ifdef MOZ_XUL
    2832           1 :     if (aDocElement->IsXULElement())
    2833             :     {
    2834             :       // pass a temporary stylecontext, the correct one will be set later
    2835           1 :       rootFrame = NS_NewRootBoxFrame(mPresShell, viewportPseudoStyle);
    2836             :     } else
    2837             : #endif
    2838             :     {
    2839             :       // pass a temporary stylecontext, the correct one will be set later
    2840           1 :       rootFrame = NS_NewCanvasFrame(mPresShell, viewportPseudoStyle);
    2841           1 :       mHasRootAbsPosContainingBlock = true;
    2842             :     }
    2843             : 
    2844           1 :     rootPseudo = nsCSSAnonBoxes::canvas;
    2845           1 :     mDocElementContainingBlock = rootFrame;
    2846             :   } else {
    2847             :     // Create a page sequence frame
    2848           1 :     rootFrame = NS_NewSimplePageSequenceFrame(mPresShell, viewportPseudoStyle);
    2849           1 :     mPageSequenceFrame = rootFrame;
    2850           1 :     rootPseudo = nsCSSAnonBoxes::pageSequence;
    2851             :   }
    2852             : 
    2853             : 
    2854             :   // --------- IF SCROLLABLE WRAP IN SCROLLFRAME --------
    2855             : 
    2856             :   // If the device supports scrolling (e.g., in galley mode on the screen and
    2857             :   // for print-preview, but not when printing), then create a scroll frame that
    2858             :   // will act as the scrolling mechanism for the viewport.
    2859             :   // XXX Do we even need a viewport when printing to a printer?
    2860             : 
    2861           1 :   bool isHTML = aDocElement->IsHTMLElement();
    2862           1 :   bool isXUL = false;
    2863             : 
    2864           1 :   if (!isHTML) {
    2865           1 :     isXUL = aDocElement->IsXULElement();
    2866             :   }
    2867             : 
    2868             :   // Never create scrollbars for XUL documents
    2869           1 :   bool isScrollable = isPaginated ? presContext->HasPaginatedScrolling() : !isXUL;
    2870             : 
    2871             :   // We no longer need to do overflow propagation here. It's taken care of
    2872             :   // when we construct frames for the element whose overflow might be
    2873             :   // propagated
    2874             :   NS_ASSERTION(!isScrollable || !isXUL,
    2875             :                "XUL documents should never be scrollable - see above");
    2876             : 
    2877           1 :   nsContainerFrame* newFrame = rootFrame;
    2878             :   RefPtr<nsStyleContext> rootPseudoStyle;
    2879             :   // we must create a state because if the scrollbars are GFX it needs the
    2880             :   // state to build the scrollbar frames.
    2881           1 :   TreeMatchContext matchContext(mDocument, TreeMatchContext::ForFrameConstruction);
    2882           1 :   nsFrameConstructorState state(mPresShell, matchContext, nullptr, nullptr, nullptr);
    2883             : 
    2884             :   // Start off with the viewport as parent; we'll adjust it as needed.
    2885           1 :   nsContainerFrame* parentFrame = viewportFrame;
    2886             : 
    2887           1 :   StyleSetHandle styleSet = mPresShell->StyleSet();
    2888             :   // If paginated, make sure we don't put scrollbars in
    2889           1 :   if (!isScrollable) {
    2890           1 :     rootPseudoStyle =
    2891             :       styleSet->ResolveInheritingAnonymousBoxStyle(rootPseudo,
    2892           1 :                                                    viewportPseudoStyle);
    2893             :   } else {
    2894           1 :       if (rootPseudo == nsCSSAnonBoxes::canvas) {
    2895           1 :         rootPseudo = nsCSSAnonBoxes::scrolledCanvas;
    2896             :       } else {
    2897             :         NS_ASSERTION(rootPseudo == nsCSSAnonBoxes::pageSequence,
    2898             :                      "Unknown root pseudo");
    2899           1 :         rootPseudo = nsCSSAnonBoxes::scrolledPageSequence;
    2900             :       }
    2901             : 
    2902             :       // Build the frame. We give it the content we are wrapping which is the
    2903             :       // document element, the root frame, the parent view port frame, and we
    2904             :       // should get back the new frame and the scrollable view if one was
    2905             :       // created.
    2906             : 
    2907             :       // resolve a context for the scrollframe
    2908             :       RefPtr<nsStyleContext>  styleContext;
    2909           1 :       styleContext =
    2910             :         styleSet->ResolveInheritingAnonymousBoxStyle(nsCSSAnonBoxes::viewportScroll,
    2911           1 :                                                      viewportPseudoStyle);
    2912             : 
    2913             :       // Note that the viewport scrollframe is always built with
    2914             :       // overflow:auto style. This forces the scroll frame to create
    2915             :       // anonymous content for both scrollbars. This is necessary even
    2916             :       // if the HTML or BODY elements are overriding the viewport
    2917             :       // scroll style to 'hidden' --- dynamic style changes might put
    2918             :       // scrollbars back on the viewport and we don't want to have to
    2919             :       // reframe the viewport to create the scrollbar content.
    2920           1 :       newFrame = nullptr;
    2921           1 :       rootPseudoStyle = BeginBuildingScrollFrame( state,
    2922             :                                                   aDocElement,

    3069             : 
    3070             : // Clears any lazy bits set in the range [aStartContent, aEndContent).  If
    3071             : // aEndContent is null, that means to clear bits in all siblings starting with
    3072             : // aStartContent.  aStartContent must not be null unless aEndContent is also
    3073             : // null.  We do this so that when new children are inserted under elements whose
    3074             : // frame is a leaf the new children don't cause us to try to construct frames
    3075             : // for the existing children again.
    3076             : static inline void
    3077           1 : ClearLazyBits(nsIContent* aStartContent, nsIContent* aEndContent)
    3078             : {
    3079             :   NS_PRECONDITION(aStartContent || !aEndContent,
    3080             :                   "Must have start child if we have an end child");
    3081           1 :   for (nsIContent* cur = aStartContent; cur != aEndContent;
    3082           1 :        cur = cur->GetNextSibling()) {
    3083           1 :     cur->UnsetFlags(NODE_DESCENDANTS_NEED_FRAMES | NODE_NEEDS_FRAME);
    3084             :   }
    3085           1 : }
    3086             :

    3812             : void
    3813           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::ConstructFrameFromItemInternal(FrameConstructionItem& aItem,

    3815             :                                                       nsContainerFrame* aParentFrame,
    3816             :                                                       nsFrameItems& aFrameItems)

    3818           1 :   const FrameConstructionData* data = aItem.mFCData;
    3819             :   NS_ASSERTION(data, "Must have frame construction data");
    3820             : 
    3821           1 :   uint32_t bits = data->mBits;

    3824             :                "Should have dealt with this inside the data finder");
    3825             : 
    3826             :   // Some sets of bits are not compatible with each other
    3827             : #define CHECK_ONLY_ONE_BIT(_bit1, _bit2)               \
    3828             :   NS_ASSERTION(!(bits & _bit1) || !(bits & _bit2),     \
    3829             :                "Only one of these bits should be set")
    3830             :   CHECK_ONLY_ONE_BIT(FCDATA_FUNC_IS_FULL_CTOR, FCDATA_FORCE_NULL_ABSPOS_CONTAINER);
    3831             :   CHECK_ONLY_ONE_BIT(FCDATA_FUNC_IS_FULL_CTOR, FCDATA_WRAP_KIDS_IN_BLOCKS);

    4186             : /**
    4187             :  * This function takes a tree of nsIAnonymousContentCreator::ContentInfo
    4188             :  * objects where the nsIContent nodes have just been created, and appends the
    4189             :  * nsIContent children in the tree to their parent. The leaf nsIContent objects
    4190             :  * are appended first to minimize the number of notifications that are sent
    4191             :  * out (i.e. by appending as many descendants as posible while their parent is
    4192             :  * not yet in the document tree).
    4193             :  *
    4194             :  * This function is used simply as a convenience so that implementations of
    4195             :  * nsIAnonymousContentCreator::CreateAnonymousContent don't all have to have
    4196             :  * their own code to connect the elements that they create.

    4641             : 
    4642             : /**
    4643             :  * Called to wrap a gfx scrollframe around a frame. The hierarchy will look like this
    4644             :  *
    4645             :  * ------- for gfx scrollbars ------
    4646             :  *
    4647             :  *
    4648             :  *            ScrollFrame
    4649             :  *                 ^
    4650             :  *                 |
    4651             :  *               Frame (scrolled frame you passed in)
    4652             :  *
    4653             :  *
    4654             :  *-----------------------------------
    4655             :  * LEGEND:
    4656             :  *
    4657             :  * ScrollFrame: This is a frame that manages gfx cross platform frame based scrollbars.
    4658             :  *
    4659             :  * @param aContent the content node of the child to wrap.
    4660             :  * @param aScrolledFrame The frame of the content to wrap. This should not be
    4661             :  *                    Initialized. This method will initialize it with a scrolled pseudo
    4662             :  *                    and no nsIContent. The content will be attached to the scrollframe
    4663             :  *                    returned.
    4664             :  * @param aContentStyle the style context that has already been resolved for the content being passed in.
    4665             :  *
    4666             :  * @param aParentFrame The parent to attach the scroll frame to
    4667             :  *
    4668             :  * @param aNewFrame The new scrollframe or gfx scrollframe that we create. It will contain the
    4669             :  *                  scrolled frame you passed in. (returned)
    4670             :  *                  If this is not null, we'll just use it
    4671             :  * @param aScrolledContentStyle the style that was resolved for the scrolled frame. (returned)
    4672             :  */
    4673             : void
    4674           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::BuildScrollFrame(nsFrameConstructorState& aState,
    4675             :                                         nsIContent*              aContent,
    4676             :                                         nsStyleContext*          aContentStyle,
    4677             :                                         nsIFrame*                aScrolledFrame,
    4678             :                                         nsContainerFrame*        aParentFrame,
    4679             :                                         nsContainerFrame*&       aNewFrame)

    4681             :   RefPtr<nsStyleContext> scrolledContentStyle =

    4683             :                              nsCSSAnonBoxes::scrolledContent,
    4684           1 :                              false, aNewFrame);
    4685             : 
    4686           1 :   aScrolledFrame->SetStyleContextWithoutNotification(scrolledContentStyle);
    4687           1 :   InitAndRestoreFrame(aState, aContent, aNewFrame, aScrolledFrame);
    4688             : 
    4689           1 :   FinishBuildingScrollFrame(aNewFrame, aScrolledFrame);

    4692             : const nsCSSFrameConstructor::FrameConstructionData*
    4693           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::FindDisplayData(const nsStyleDisplay* aDisplay,
    4694             :                                        Element* aElement,
    4695             :                                        nsStyleContext* aStyleContext)
    4696             : {
    4697             :   static_assert(eParentTypeCount < (1 << (32 - FCDATA_PARENT_TYPE_OFFSET)),
    4698             :                 "Check eParentTypeCount should not overflow");
    4699             : 
    4700             :   // The style system ensures that floated and positioned frames are
    4701             :   // block-level.
    4702             :   NS_ASSERTION(!(aDisplay->IsFloatingStyle() ||
    4703             :                  aDisplay->IsAbsolutelyPositionedStyle()) ||
    4704             :                aDisplay->IsBlockOutsideStyle() ||
    4705             :                aDisplay->mDisplay == StyleDisplay::Contents,
    4706             :                "Style system did not apply CSS2.1 section 9.7 fixups");
    4707             : 
    4708             :   // If this is "body", try propagating its scroll style to the viewport
    4709             :   // Note that we need to do this even if the body is NOT scrollable;
    4710             :   // it might have dynamically changed from scrollable to not scrollable,
    4711             :   // and that might need to be propagated.
    4712             :   // XXXbz is this the right place to do this?  If this code moves,
    4713             :   // make this function static.
    4714           1 :   bool propagatedScrollToViewport = false;
    4715           1 :   if (aElement->IsHTMLElement(nsGkAtoms::body)) {

    5422             :     // svg:svg not contained within svg:svg are incorrect, although they
    5423             :     // don't seem to specify error handling.  Ignore them, since many of
    5424             :     // our frame classes can't deal.  It *may* be that the document
    5425             :     // should at that point be considered in error according to F.2, but
    5426             :     // it's hard to tell.

    5635             : bool

    5642             :     // We can't just remove our pending restyle flags, since we may
    5643             :     // have restyle-later-siblings set on us.  But we _can_ remove the
    5644             :     // "is possible restyle root" flags, and need to.  Otherwise we can
    5645             :     // end up with stale such flags (e.g. if we used to have a
    5646             :     // display:none parent when our last restyle was posted and
    5647             :     // processed and now no longer do).

    5649           1 :                          ~ELEMENT_PENDING_RESTYLE_FLAGS);

    5655           1 :       aContent->GetPrimaryFrame()->GetContent() == aContent &&
    5656           0 :       !aState.mCreatingExtraFrames) {
    5657             :     NS_ERROR("asked to create frame construction item for a node that already "
    5658             :              "has a frame");

    5660             :   }

    5747           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::AddFrameConstructionItemsInternal(nsFrameConstructorState& aState,

    6098             :       // sense that anything that will really end up as an in-flow non-inline
    6099             :       // will test false here.  In other words, if this test is true we're
    6100             :       // guaranteed to be inline; if it's false we don't know what we'll end up
    6101             :       // as.
    6102             :       //

    6290             : {

    6292             :   // relatively positioned (and transformed, if aType is FIXED)

    6387             : 
    6388             : /**
    6389             :  * This function will check whether aContainer has :after generated content.
    6390             :  * If so, appending to it should actually insert.  The return value is the
    6391             :  * parent to use for newly-appended content.  *aAfterFrame points to the :after
    6392             :  * frame before which appended content should go, if there is one.
    6393             :  */
    6394             : static nsContainerFrame*
    6395           1 : AdjustAppendParentForAfterContent(nsFrameManager* aFrameManager,
    6396             :                                   nsIContent* aContainer,
    6397             :                                   nsContainerFrame* aParentFrame,
    6398             :                                   nsIContent* aChild,
    6399             :                                   nsIFrame** aAfterFrame)
    6400             : {
    6401             :   // If the parent frame has any pseudo-elements or aContainer is a
    6402             :   // display:contents node then we need to walk through the child
    6403             :   // frames to find the first one that is either a ::after frame for an
    6404             :   // ancestor of aChild or a frame that is for a node later in the
    6405             :   // document than aChild and return that in aAfterFrame.
    6406           1 :   if (aParentFrame->GetGenConPseudos() ||
    6407             :       nsLayoutUtils::HasPseudoStyle(aContainer, aParentFrame->StyleContext(),
    6408             :                                     CSSPseudoElementType::after,
    6409           1 :                                     aParentFrame->PresContext()) ||
    6410           1 :       aFrameManager->GetDisplayContentsStyleFor(aContainer)) {
    6411           1 :     nsIFrame* afterFrame = nullptr;
    6412             :     nsContainerFrame* parent =
    6413           1 :       static_cast<nsContainerFrame*>(aParentFrame->LastContinuation());
    6414           1 :     bool done = false;
    6415           1 :     while (!done && parent) {
    6416             :       // Ensure that all normal flow children are on the principal child list.
    6417           1 :       parent->DrainSelfOverflowList();
    6418             : 
    6419           1 :       nsIFrame* child = parent->GetChildList(nsIFrame::kPrincipalList).LastChild();
    6420           1 :       if (child && child->IsPseudoFrame(aContainer) &&
    6421             :           !child->IsGeneratedContentFrame()) {
    6422             :         // Drill down into non-generated pseudo frames of aContainer.
    6423           1 :         nsContainerFrame* childAsContainer = do_QueryFrame(child);
    6424           1 :         if (childAsContainer) {
    6425           1 :           parent = nsLayoutUtils::LastContinuationWithChild(childAsContainer);
    6426           1 :           continue;
    6427             :         }
    6428             :       }
    6429             : 
    6430           1 :       for (; child; child = child->GetPrevSibling()) {
    6431           1 :         nsIContent* c = child->GetContent();
    6432           1 :         if (child->IsGeneratedContentFrame()) {
    6433           1 :           nsIContent* p = c->GetParent();
    6434           1 :           if (c->NodeInfo()->NameAtom() == nsGkAtoms::mozgeneratedcontentafter) {
    6435           1 :             if (!nsContentUtils::ContentIsDescendantOf(aChild, p) &&
    6436           1 :                 p != aContainer &&
    6437           0 :                 nsContentUtils::PositionIsBefore(p, aChild)) {
    6438             :               // ::after generated content for content earlier in the doc and not
    6439             :               // for an ancestor.  "p != aContainer" may seem redundant but it
    6440             :               // checks if the ::after belongs to the XBL insertion point we're
    6441             :               // inserting aChild into (in which case ContentIsDescendantOf is
    6442             :               // false even though p == aContainer).
    6443             :               // See layout/reftests/bugs/482592-1a.xhtml for an example of that.
    6444             :               done = true;
    6445             :               break;
    6446             :             }
    6447           1 :           } else if (nsContentUtils::PositionIsBefore(p, aChild)) {
    6448             :             // Non-::after generated content for content earlier in the doc.
    6449             :             done = true;
    6450             :             break;
    6451             :           }
    6452           1 :         } else if (nsContentUtils::PositionIsBefore(c, aChild)) {
    6453             :           // Content is before aChild.
    6454             :           done = true;
    6455             :           break;
    6456             :         }
    6457           1 :         afterFrame = child;
    6458             :       }
    6459             : 
    6460           1 :       parent = static_cast<nsContainerFrame*>(parent->GetPrevContinuation());
    6461             :     }

    6626             : #define UNSET_DISPLAY static_cast<StyleDisplay>(255)

    6628             : // This gets called to see if the frames corresponding to aSibling and aContent

    6681             :     // the same desired parent type and live on different display lists.

    6683             :     // column groups as valid siblings.  Captions should only consider other
    6684             :     // captions.  All other things should consider each other as valid

    6687             :     // not consider captions, column groups, and row/header/footer groups

    7192           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::CreateNeededFrames(

    7350           1 :     if (!insertionPoint.mMultiple) {

    7352             :       // reasonable heuristic to employ (in order to maintain good performance)

    7422           0 :   for (nsIContent* child = aStartChild; child != aEndChild;
    7423           0 :        child = child->GetNextSibling()) {
    7424             :     // Calling StyleNewChildren on one child will end up styling another child,
    7425             :     // if they share the same flattened tree parent.  So we check HasServoData()
    7426             :     // to avoid a wasteful call to GetFlattenedTreeParent (on the child) and
    7427             :     // StyleNewChildren (on the flattened tree parent) when we detect we've
    7428             :     // already handled that parent.  In the common case of inserting elements
    7429             :     // into a container that does not have an XBL binding or shadow tree with
    7430             :     // distributed children, this boils down to a single call to
    7431             :     // GetFlattenedTreeParent/StyleNewChildren, and traversing the list of
    7432             :     // children checking HasServoData (which is fast).
    7433           0 :     if (child->IsElement() && !child->AsElement()->HasServoData()) {
    7434             :       Element* parent = child->AsElement()->GetFlattenedTreeParentElement();
    7435             :       // NB: Parent may be null if the content is appended to a shadow root, and
    7436             :       // isn't assigned to any insertion point.
    7437             :       if (MOZ_LIKELY(parent) && parent->HasServoData()) {
    7438             :         styleSet->StyleNewChildren(parent);
    7439             :       }
    7440             :     }
    7441             :   }
    7442           0 : }

    7800             : 
    7801             : // Helper function to lookup the listbox body frame and send a notification
    7802             : // for insertion or removal of content
    7803             : static
    7804           1 : bool NotifyListBoxBody(nsPresContext*    aPresContext,

    7832             : 
    7833             : void
    7834           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::ContentInserted(nsIContent*            aContainer,
    7835             :                                        nsIContent*            aChild,
    7836             :                                        nsILayoutHistoryState* aFrameState,
    7837             :                                        bool                   aAllowLazyConstruction)
    7838             : {
    7839             :   ContentRangeInserted(aContainer,
    7840             :                        aChild,
    7841             :                        aChild->GetNextSibling(),
    7842             :                        aFrameState,
    7843           1 :                        aAllowLazyConstruction);
    7844           1 : }
    7845             : 
    7846             : // ContentRangeInserted handles creating frames for a range of nodes that
    7847             : // aren't at the end of their childlist. ContentRangeInserted isn't a real
    7848             : // content notification, but rather it handles regular ContentInserted calls
    7849             : // for a single node as well as the lazy construction of frames for a range of
    7850             : // nodes when called from CreateNeededFrames. For a range of nodes to be
    7851             : // suitable to have its frames constructed all at once they must meet the same
    7852             : // conditions that ContentAppended imposes (GetRangeInsertionPoint checks
    7853             : // these), plus more. Namely when finding the insertion prevsibling we must not
    7854             : // need to consult something specific to any one node in the range, so that the
    7855             : // insertion prevsibling would be the same for each node in the range. So we
    7856             : // pass the first node in the range to GetInsertionPrevSibling, and if
    7857             : // IsValidSibling (the only place GetInsertionPrevSibling might look at the
    7858             : // passed in node itself) needs to resolve style on the node we record this and
    7859             : // return that this range needs to be split up and inserted separately. Table
    7860             : // captions need extra attention as we need to determine where to insert them
    7861             : // in the caption list, while skipping any nodes in the range being inserted
    7862             : // (because when we treat the caption frames the other nodes have had their
    7863             : // frames constructed but not yet inserted into the frame tree).
    7864             : void
    7865           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::ContentRangeInserted(nsIContent* aContainer,
    7866             :                                             nsIContent* aStartChild,
    7867             :                                             nsIContent* aEndChild,
    7868             :                                             nsILayoutHistoryState* aFrameState,
    7869             :                                             bool aAllowLazyConstruction,
    7870             :                                             bool aForReconstruction,
    7871             :                                             TreeMatchContext* aProvidedTreeMatchContext)
    7872             : {
    7873             :   MOZ_ASSERT_IF(aProvidedTreeMatchContext, !aAllowLazyConstruction);

    7879             : 
    7880             :   NS_PRECONDITION(aStartChild, "must always pass a child");

    7990             :   // The frame constructor uses this codepath both for bonafide newly-added
    7991             :   // content and for RestyleManager-driven frame construction (RECONSTRUCT_FRAME

    8311           1 :     if (nsGkAtoms::tableFrame == frameType ||
    8312           1 :         nsGkAtoms::tableWrapperFrame == frameType) {

    8316             : 
    8317             :   // If the parent of our current prevSibling is different from the frame we'll
    8318             :   // actually use as the parent, then the calculated insertion point is now
    8319             :   // invalid and as it is unknown where to insert correctly we append instead
    8320             :   // (bug 341858).
    8321             :   // This can affect our prevSibling and isAppend, but should not have any
    8322             :   // effect on the WipeContainingBlock above, since this should only happen
    8323             :   // when neither parent is a ib-split frame and should not affect whitespace
    8324             :   // handling inside table-related frames (and in fact, can only happen when
    8325             :   // one of the parents is a table wrapper and one is an inner table or when the
    8326             :   // parent is a fieldset or fieldset content frame).  So it won't affect the
    8327             :   // {ib} or XUL box cases in WipeContainingBlock(), and the table pseudo
    8328             :   // handling will only be affected by us maybe thinking we're not inserting
    8329             :   // at the beginning, whereas we really are.  That would have made us reframe
    8330             :   // unnecessarily, but that's ok.
    8331             :   // XXXbz we should push our frame construction item code up higher, so we

    8465             : 
    8466             : void
    8467           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::ContentRemoved(nsIContent*  aContainer,
    8468             :                                       nsIContent*  aChild,
    8469             :                                       nsIContent*  aOldNextSibling,
    8470             :                                       RemoveFlags  aFlags,
    8471             :                                       bool*        aDidReconstruct,
    8472             :                                       nsIContent** aDestroyedFramesFor)
    8473             : {
    8474             :   AUTO_LAYOUT_PHASE_ENTRY_POINT(mPresShell->GetPresContext(), FrameC);
    8475             :   NS_PRECONDITION(mUpdateCount != 0,
    8476             :                   "Should be in an update while destroying frames");
    8477             : 
    8478           1 :   *aDidReconstruct = false;
    8479           1 :   if (aDestroyedFramesFor) {
    8480           1 :     *aDestroyedFramesFor = aChild;
    8481             :   }
    8482             : 
    8483             :   // We're destroying our frame(s). This normally happens either when the content
    8484             :   // is being removed from the DOM (in which case we'll drop all Servo data in
    8485             :   // UnbindFromTree), or when we're recreating frames (usually in response to
    8486             :   // having retrieved a ReconstructFrame change hint after restyling). In both of
    8487             :   // those cases, there are no pending restyles we need to worry about.
    8488             :   //
    8489             :   // However, there is also the (rare) DestroyFramesFor path, in which we tear
    8490             :   // down (and usually recreate) the frames for a subtree. In this case, leaving
    8491             :   // the style data on the elements is problematic for our invariants, because
    8492             :   // there might be pending restyles in the subtree. If we simply leave them as-is,
    8493             :   // the subsequent traversal when recreating frames will generate a bunch of bogus
    8494             :   // change hints to update frames that no longer exist.
    8495             :   //
    8496             :   // So the two obvious options are to (1) process all pending restyles and take all
    8497             :   // the change hints before destroying the frames, or (2) drop all the style data.
    8498             :   // We chose the latter, since that matches the performance characteristics of the
    8499             :   // old Gecko style system.
    8500             :   //
    8501             :   // That said, it's almost certainly possible to optimize this if it turns out to be
    8502             :   // hot. It's just not a priority at the moment.
    8503             :   if (aFlags == REMOVE_DESTROY_FRAMES && aChild->IsElement() && aChild->IsStyledByServo()) {
    8504             :     ServoRestyleManager::ClearServoDataFromSubtree(aChild->AsElement());
    8505             :   }
    8506             : 
    8507           1 :   if (aChild->IsHTMLElement(nsGkAtoms::body) ||
    8508           1 :       (!aContainer && aChild->IsElement())) {
    8509             :     // This might be the element we propagated viewport scrollbar
    8510             :     // styles from.  Recompute those.
    8511           1 :     mPresShell->GetPresContext()->UpdateViewportScrollbarStylesOverride();
    8512             :   }
    8513             : 
    8514             :   // XXXldb Do we need to re-resolve style to handle the CSS2 + combinator and
    8515             :   // the :empty pseudo-class?
    8516             : 
    8517             : #ifdef DEBUG
    8518             :   if (gNoisyContentUpdates) {
    8519             :     printf("nsCSSFrameConstructor::ContentRemoved container=%p child=%p "
    8520             :            "old-next-sibling=%p\n",
    8521             :            static_cast<void*>(aContainer),
    8522             :            static_cast<void*>(aChild),
    8523             :            static_cast<void*>(aOldNextSibling));
    8524             :     if (gReallyNoisyContentUpdates) {
    8525             :       aContainer->List(stdout, 0);
    8526             :     }
    8527             :   }
    8528             : #endif

    8777             :     // following ContentInserted notification on the element will

    8791             :       // child then it can stay suppressed since the parent must be a block

    9693           1 :                                aDestroyedFramesFor);
    9694           1 :       return true;
    9695             :     }
    9696             :   }
    9697             : 
    9698             :   // Might need to reconstruct things if this frame's nextSibling is a table
    9699             :   // or ruby pseudo, since removal of this frame might mean that this pseudo
    9700             :   // needs to get merged with the frame's prevSibling if that's also a table
    9701             :   // or ruby pseudo.
    9702             :   nsIFrame* nextSibling =
    9703           1 :     FindNextNonWhitespaceSibling(inFlowFrame->LastContinuation());
    9704             :   NS_ASSERTION(!IsTableOrRubyPseudo(inFlowFrame), "Shouldn't happen here");
    9705             :   // Effectively, for the ruby pseudo sibling case, only pseudo <ruby> frame

    9707             :   // a ruby container parent, and be catched by "Check ruby containers" below.

    9709           1 :     nsIFrame* prevSibling = FindPreviousNonWhitespaceSibling(inFlowFrame);
    9710           1 :     if (prevSibling && IsTableOrRubyPseudo(prevSibling)) {
    9711             : #ifdef DEBUG
    9712             :       if (gNoisyContentUpdates) {
    9713             :         printf("nsCSSFrameConstructor::MaybeRecreateContainerForFrameRemoval: "
    9714             :                "frame=");
    9715             :         nsFrame::ListTag(stdout, aFrame);
    9716             :         printf(" has a table pseudo next sibling of different type and a "
    9717             :                "table pseudo prevsibling\n");
    9718             :       }

    9721             :       // aFrame's parent is a pseudo, that'll be the right content node.

    9723           0 :                                aDestroyedFramesFor);

    9725             :     }
    9726             :   }
    9727             : 
    9728             :   // Check ruby containers

    9731           1 :       RubyUtils::IsRubyContainerBox(parentType)) {

    9844             : void
    9845           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::RecreateFramesForContent(nsIContent*  aContent,
    9846             :                                                 bool         aAsyncInsert,
    9847             :                                                 RemoveFlags  aFlags,
    9848             :                                                 nsIContent** aDestroyedFramesFor)
    9849             : {
    9850             :   NS_PRECONDITION(!aAsyncInsert || aContent->IsElement(),
    9851             :                   "Can only insert elements async");
    9852             :   // If there is no document, we don't want to recreate frames for it.  (You
    9853             :   // shouldn't generally be giving this method content without a document
    9854             :   // anyway).
    9855             :   // Rebuilding the frame tree can have bad effects, especially if it's the
    9856             :   // frame tree for chrome (see bug 157322).
    9857           1 :   if (NS_WARN_IF(!aContent->GetComposedDoc())) {
    9858           1 :     return;
    9859             :   }

    9861             :   // Is the frame ib-split? If so, we need to reframe the containing
    9862             :   // block *here*, rather than trying to remove and re-insert the
