   10146             : 
   10147             : void
   10148           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::CreateNeededAnonFlexOrGridItems(
   10149             :   nsFrameConstructorState& aState,
   10150             :   FrameConstructionItemList& aItems,
   10151             :   nsIFrame* aParentFrame)
   10152             : {
   10153           1 :   if (aItems.IsEmpty()) {
   10154           1 :     return;
   10155             :   }
   10156           1 :   const nsIAtom* parentType = aParentFrame->GetType();
   10157           1 :   if (parentType != nsGkAtoms::flexContainerFrame &&
   10158           1 :       parentType != nsGkAtoms::gridContainerFrame) {
   10159             :     return;
   10160             :   }
   10161             : 
   10162             :   const bool isWebkitBox = IsFlexContainerForLegacyBox(aParentFrame,
   10163           1 :                                                        parentType);
   10164           1 :   FCItemIterator iter(aItems);
   10165           1 :   do {
   10166             :     // Advance iter past children that don't want to be wrapped
   10167           1 :     if (iter.SkipItemsThatDontNeedAnonFlexOrGridItem(aState, isWebkitBox)) {
   10168             :       // Hit the end of the items without finding any remaining children that
   10169             :       // need to be wrapped. We're finished!
   10170           1 :       return;
   10171             :     }
   10172             : 
   10173             :     // If our next potentially-wrappable child is whitespace, then see if
   10174             :     // there's anything wrappable immediately after it. If not, we just drop
   10175             :     // the whitespace and move on. (We're not supposed to create any anonymous
   10176             :     // flex/grid items that _only_ contain whitespace).
   10177             :     // (BUT if this is generated content, then we don't give whitespace nodes
   10178             :     // any special treatment, because they're probably not really whitespace --
   10179             :     // they're just temporarily empty, waiting for their generated text.)
   10180             :     // XXXdholbert If this node's generated text will *actually end up being
   10181             :     // entirely whitespace*, then we technically should still skip over it, per
   10182             :     // the CSS grid & flexbox specs. I'm not bothering with that at this point,
   10183             :     // since it's a pretty extreme edge case.
   10184           1 :     if (!aParentFrame->IsGeneratedContentFrame() &&
   10185           1 :         iter.item().IsWhitespace(aState)) {
   10186             :       FCItemIterator afterWhitespaceIter(iter);
   10187           1 :       bool hitEnd = afterWhitespaceIter.SkipWhitespace(aState);
   10188             :       bool nextChildNeedsAnonItem =
   10189           1 :         !hitEnd &&
   10190           1 :         afterWhitespaceIter.item().NeedsAnonFlexOrGridItem(aState, isWebkitBox);
   10191             : 
   10192           1 :       if (!nextChildNeedsAnonItem) {
   10193             :         // There's nothing after the whitespace that we need to wrap, so we
   10194             :         // just drop this run of whitespace.
   10195           1 :         iter.DeleteItemsTo(afterWhitespaceIter);
   10196           1 :         if (hitEnd) {
   10197             :           // Nothing left to do -- we're finished!
   10198           1 :           return;
   10199             :         }
   10200             :         // else, we have a next child and it does not want to be wrapped.  So,
   10201             :         // we jump back to the beginning of the loop to skip over that child
   10202             :         // (and anything else non-wrappable after it)
   10203             :         MOZ_ASSERT(!iter.IsDone() &&
   10204             :                    !iter.item().NeedsAnonFlexOrGridItem(aState, isWebkitBox),
   10205             :                    "hitEnd and/or nextChildNeedsAnonItem lied");
   10206           1 :         continue;
   10207             :       }
   10208             :     }
   10209             : 
   10210             :     // Now |iter| points to the first child that needs to be wrapped in an
   10211             :     // anonymous flex/grid item. Now we see how many children after it also want
   10212             :     // to be wrapped in an anonymous flex/grid item.
   10213             :     FCItemIterator endIter(iter); // iterator to find the end of the group
   10214           1 :     endIter.SkipItemsThatNeedAnonFlexOrGridItem(aState, isWebkitBox);
   10215             : 
   10216             :     NS_ASSERTION(iter != endIter,
   10217             :                  "Should've had at least one wrappable child to seek past");
   10218             : 
   10219             :     // Now, we create the anonymous flex or grid item to contain the children
   10220             :     // between |iter| and |endIter|.
   10221           1 :     nsIAtom* pseudoType = (aParentFrame->GetType() == nsGkAtoms::flexContainerFrame) ?
   10222           1 :       nsCSSAnonBoxes::anonymousFlexItem : nsCSSAnonBoxes::anonymousGridItem;
   10223           1 :     nsStyleContext* parentStyle = aParentFrame->StyleContext();
   10224           1 :     nsIContent* parentContent = aParentFrame->GetContent();
   10225             :     already_AddRefed<nsStyleContext> wrapperStyle =
   10226             :       mPresShell->StyleSet()->ResolveInheritingAnonymousBoxStyle(pseudoType,
   10227           1 :                                                                  parentStyle);
   10228             : 
   10229             :     static const FrameConstructionData sBlockFormattingContextFCData =
   10230             :       FCDATA_DECL(FCDATA_SKIP_FRAMESET | FCDATA_USE_CHILD_ITEMS,
   10231             :                   NS_NewBlockFormattingContext);
   10232             : 
   10233             :     FrameConstructionItem* newItem =
   10234             :       new FrameConstructionItem(&sBlockFormattingContextFCData,
   10235             :                                 // Use the content of our parent frame
   10236             :                                 parentContent,
   10237             :                                 // Lie about the tag; it doesn't matter anyway

   10239           1 :                                 iter.item().mNameSpaceID,
   10240             :                                 // no pending binding
   10241             :                                 nullptr,
   10242             :                                 wrapperStyle,
   10243           1 :                                 true, nullptr);
   10244             : 
   10245             :     newItem->mIsAllInline = newItem->mHasInlineEnds =
   10246           1 :       newItem->mStyleContext->StyleDisplay()->IsInlineOutsideStyle();

   10248             : 
   10249             :     MOZ_ASSERT(!newItem->mIsAllInline && newItem->mIsBlock,
   10250             :                "expecting anonymous flex/grid items to be block-level "
   10251             :                "(this will make a difference when we encounter "
   10252             :                "'align-items: baseline')");
   10253             : 
   10254             :     // Anonymous flex and grid items induce line boundaries around their
   10255             :     // contents.
   10256           1 :     newItem->mChildItems.SetLineBoundaryAtStart(true);

   10264             :     // wrapper. This advances |iter| to point to |endIter|.

   10267           1 :     iter.InsertItem(newItem);
   10268           1 :   } while (!iter.IsDone());

   10270             : 
   10271             : /* static */ nsCSSFrameConstructor::RubyWhitespaceType
   10272           0 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::ComputeRubyWhitespaceType(StyleDisplay aPrevDisplay,
   10273             :                                                  StyleDisplay aNextDisplay)
   10274             : {
   10275             :   MOZ_ASSERT(nsStyleDisplay::IsRubyDisplayType(aPrevDisplay) &&

   10283             :       aNextDisplay == StyleDisplay::RubyTextContainer) {

   10285             :   }

   10288             : 
   10289             : /**
   10290             :  * This function checks the content from |aStartIter| to |aEndIter|,
   10291             :  * determines whether it contains only whitespace, and if yes,
   10292             :  * interprets the type of whitespace. This method does not change
   10293             :  * any of the iters.
   10294             :  */
   10295             : /* static */ nsCSSFrameConstructor::RubyWhitespaceType
   10296           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::InterpretRubyWhitespace(nsFrameConstructorState& aState,

   10299             : {
   10300           1 :   if (!aStartIter.item().IsWhitespace(aState)) {
   10301             :     return eRubyNotWhitespace;
   10302             :   }
   10303             :

   10306           0 :   if (spaceEndIter != aEndIter) {
   10307             :     return eRubyNotWhitespace;

   10309             :

   10311             :   // should have been trimmed, hence there should not be any

   10328           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::WrapItemsInPseudoRubyLeafBox(

   10353             : /**

   10359           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::WrapItemsInPseudoRubyLevelContainer(
   10360             :   nsFrameConstructorState& aState, FCItemIterator& aIter,

   10362             : {

   10364             :              "Pointing to a level container?");
   10365             : 
   10366           1 :   FrameConstructionItem& firstItem = aIter.item();
   10367           1 :   ParentType wrapperType = firstItem.DesiredParentType();

   10370             :     // it should be in a base container.

   10375           1 :   do {

   10378             :         // different ruby parent, then we have finished.

   10381             :       break;

   10468             : /**
   10469             :  * This function walks through the child list (aItems) and creates

   10472             : void
   10473           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::CreateNeededPseudoInternalRubyBoxes(
   10474             :   nsFrameConstructorState& aState,
   10475             :   FrameConstructionItemList& aItems,
   10476             :   nsIFrame* aParentFrame)
   10477             : {
   10478           1 :   const ParentType ourParentType = GetParentType(aParentFrame);
   10479           1 :   if (!IsRubyParentType(ourParentType) ||
   10480             :       aItems.AllWantParentType(ourParentType)) {
   10481           1 :     return;
   10482             :   }
   10483             : 
   10484           1 :   if (!IsRubyPseudo(aParentFrame)) {
   10485             :     // Normally, ruby pseudo frames start from and end at some elements,
   10486             :     // which means they don't have leading and trailing whitespaces at
   10487             :     // all.  But there are two cases where they do actually have leading
   10488             :     // or trailing whitespaces:
   10489             :     // 1. It is an inter-segment whitespace which in an individual ruby
   10490             :     //    base container.
   10491             :     // 2. The pseudo frame starts from or ends at consecutive inline
   10492             :     //    content, which is not pure whitespace, but includes some.
   10493             :     // In either case, the whitespaces are not the leading or trailing
   10494             :     // whitespaces defined in the spec, and thus should not be trimmed.
   10495           1 :     TrimLeadingAndTrailingWhitespaces(aState, aItems);
   10496             :   }
   10497             : 
   10498           1 :   FCItemIterator iter(aItems);
   10499           1 :   nsIContent* parentContent = aParentFrame->GetContent();
   10500           1 :   nsStyleContext* parentStyle = aParentFrame->StyleContext();
   10501           1 :   while (!iter.IsDone()) {
   10502           1 :     if (!iter.SkipItemsWantingParentType(ourParentType)) {
   10503           1 :       if (ourParentType == eTypeRuby) {
   10504             :         WrapItemsInPseudoRubyLevelContainer(aState, iter, parentStyle,
   10505           1 :                                             parentContent);
   10506             :       } else {
   10507           1 :         WrapItemsInPseudoRubyLeafBox(iter, parentStyle, parentContent);
   10508             :       }
   10509             :     }
   10510             :   }
   10511             : }
   10512             : 
   10513             : /*
   10514             :  * This function works as follows: we walk through the child list (aItems) and
   10515             :  * find items that cannot have aParentFrame as their parent.  We wrap
   10516             :  * continuous runs of such items into a FrameConstructionItem for a frame that
   10517             :  * gets them closer to their desired parents.  For example, a run of non-row
   10518             :  * children of a row-group will get wrapped in a row.  When we later construct
   10519             :  * the frame for this wrapper (in this case for the row), it'll be the correct
   10520             :  * parent for the cells in the set of items we wrapped or we'll wrap cells
   10521             :  * around everything else.  At the end of this method, aItems is guaranteed to
   10522             :  * contain only items for frames that can be direct kids of aParentFrame.
   10523             :  */
   10524             : void
   10525           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::CreateNeededPseudoContainers(
   10526             :     nsFrameConstructorState& aState,
   10527             :     FrameConstructionItemList& aItems,
   10528             :     nsIFrame* aParentFrame)
   10529             : {
   10530           1 :   ParentType ourParentType = GetParentType(aParentFrame);
   10531           1 :   if (IsRubyParentType(ourParentType) ||
   10532             :       aItems.AllWantParentType(ourParentType)) {
   10533             :     // Nothing to do here
   10534           1 :     return;
   10535             :   }
   10536             : 
   10537           1 :   FCItemIterator iter(aItems);
   10538           1 :   do {
   10539           1 :     if (iter.SkipItemsWantingParentType(ourParentType)) {
   10540             :       // Nothing else to do here; we're finished
   10541           1 :       return;
   10542             :     }
   10543             : 
   10544             :     // Now we're pointing to the first child that wants a different parent
   10545             :     // type.
   10546             : 
   10547             :     // Now try to figure out what kids we can group together.  We can generally
   10548             :     // group everything that has a different desired parent type from us.  Two
   10549             :     // exceptions to this:
   10550             :     // 1) If our parent type is table, we can't group columns with anything
   10551             :     //    else other than whitespace.
   10552             :     // 2) Whitespace that lies between two things we can group which both want
   10553             :     //    a non-block parent should be dropped, even if we can't group them
   10554             :     //    with each other and even if the whitespace wants a parent of
   10555             :     //    ourParentType.  Ends of the list count as things that don't want a
   10556             :     //    block parent (so that for example we'll drop a whitespace-only list).
   10557             : 
   10558             :     FCItemIterator endIter(iter); /* iterator to find the end of the group */
   10559           1 :     ParentType groupingParentType = endIter.item().DesiredParentType();
   10560           1 :     if (aItems.AllWantParentType(groupingParentType) &&
   10561             :         groupingParentType != eTypeBlock) {
   10562             :       // Just group them all and be done with it.  We need the check for
   10563             :       // eTypeBlock here to catch the "all the items are whitespace" case
   10564             :       // described above.
   10565           1 :       endIter.SetToEnd();
   10566             :     } else {
   10567             :       // Locate the end of the group.
   10568             : 
   10569             :       // Keep track of the type the previous item wanted, in case we have to
   10570             :       // deal with whitespace.  Start it off with ourParentType, since that's
   10571             :       // the last thing |iter| would have skipped over.
   10572             :       ParentType prevParentType = ourParentType;
   10573           1 :       do {
   10574             :         // Walk an iterator past any whitespace that we might be able to drop
   10575             :         // from the list
   10576             :         FCItemIterator spaceEndIter(endIter);
   10577           1 :         if (prevParentType != eTypeBlock &&
   10578           1 :             !aParentFrame->IsGeneratedContentFrame() &&
   10579           1 :             spaceEndIter.item().IsWhitespace(aState)) {
   10580           1 :           bool trailingSpaces = spaceEndIter.SkipWhitespace(aState);
   10581             : 
   10582             :           // We drop the whitespace in the following cases:
   10583             :           // 1) If these are not trailing spaces and the next item wants a table
   10584             :           //    or table-part parent
   10585             :           // 2) If these are trailing spaces and aParentFrame is a
   10586             :           //    tabular container according to rule 1.3 of CSS 2.1 Sec 17.2.1.
   10587             :           //    (Being a tabular container pretty much means ourParentType is
   10588             :           //    not eTypeBlock besides the eTypeColGroup case, which won't
   10589             :           //    reach here.)
   10590           1 :           if ((!trailingSpaces &&
   10591           1 :                IsTableParentType(spaceEndIter.item().DesiredParentType())) ||
   10592           1 :               (trailingSpaces && ourParentType != eTypeBlock)) {
   10593           1 :             bool updateStart = (iter == endIter);
   10594           1 :             endIter.DeleteItemsTo(spaceEndIter);
   10595             :             NS_ASSERTION(trailingSpaces == endIter.IsDone(),
   10596             :                          "These should match");
   10597             : 
   10598           1 :             if (updateStart) {
   10599           1 :               iter = endIter;
   10600             :             }
   10601             : 
   10602           1 :             if (trailingSpaces) {
   10603             :               break; /* Found group end */
   10604             :             }
   10605             : 
   10606           1 :             if (updateStart) {
   10607             :               // Update groupingParentType, since it might have been eTypeBlock
   10608             :               // just because of the whitespace.
   10609           1 :               groupingParentType = iter.item().DesiredParentType();
   10610             :             }
   10611             :           }
   10612             :         }
   10613             : 
   10614             :         // Now endIter points to a non-whitespace item or a non-droppable
   10615             :         // whitespace item. In the latter case, if this is the end of the group
   10616             :         // we'll traverse this whitespace again.  But it'll all just be quick
   10617             :         // DesiredParentType() checks which will match ourParentType (that's
   10618             :         // what it means that this is the group end), so it's OK.
   10619             :         // However, when we are grouping a ruby parent, and endIter points to
   10620             :         // a non-droppable whitespace, if the next non-whitespace item also
   10621             :         // wants a ruby parent, the whitespace should also be included into
   10622             :         // the current ruby container.
   10623           1 :         prevParentType = endIter.item().DesiredParentType();
   10624           1 :         if (prevParentType == ourParentType &&
   10625           1 :             (endIter == spaceEndIter ||
   10626           1 :              spaceEndIter.IsDone() ||
   10627           1 :              !IsRubyParentType(groupingParentType) ||
   10628           1 :              !IsRubyParentType(spaceEndIter.item().DesiredParentType()))) {
   10629             :           // End the group at endIter.
   10630             :           break;
   10631             :         }
   10632             : 
   10633           1 :         if (ourParentType == eTypeTable &&
   10634           1 :             (prevParentType == eTypeColGroup) !=
   10635             :             (groupingParentType == eTypeColGroup)) {
   10636             :           // Either we started with columns and now found something else, or vice
   10637             :           // versa.  In any case, end the grouping.
   10638             :           break;
   10639             :         }
   10640             : 
   10641             :         // If we have some whitespace that we were not able to drop and there is
   10642             :         // an item after the whitespace that is already properly parented, then
   10643             :         // make sure to include the spaces in our group but stop the group after
   10644             :         // that.
   10645           1 :         if (spaceEndIter != endIter &&
   10646           1 :             !spaceEndIter.IsDone() &&
   10647           1 :             ourParentType == spaceEndIter.item().DesiredParentType()) {
   10648           0 :             endIter = spaceEndIter;
   10649             :             break;
   10650             :         }
   10651             : 
   10652             :         // Include the whitespace we didn't drop (if any) in the group.
   10653           1 :         endIter = spaceEndIter;
   10654           1 :         prevParentType = endIter.item().DesiredParentType();
   10655             : 
   10656           1 :         endIter.Next();
   10657           1 :       } while (!endIter.IsDone());
   10658             :     }
   10659             : 
   10660           1 :     if (iter == endIter) {
   10661             :       // Nothing to wrap here; just skipped some whitespace
   10662           1 :       continue;
   10663             :     }
   10664             : 
   10665             :     // Now group together all the items between iter and endIter.  The right
   10666             :     // parent type to use depends on ourParentType.
   10667             :     ParentType wrapperType;
   10668           1 :     switch (ourParentType) {
   10669             :       case eTypeRow:
   10670             :         // The parent type for a cell is eTypeBlock, since that's what a cell
   10671             :         // looks like to its kids.
   10672             :         wrapperType = eTypeBlock;
   10673             :         break;
   10674             :       case eTypeRowGroup:
   10675           1 :         wrapperType = eTypeRow;
   10676           1 :         break;

   10678             :         // Either colgroup or rowgroup, depending on what we're grouping.
   10679             :         wrapperType = groupingParentType == eTypeColGroup ?
   10680           1 :           eTypeColGroup : eTypeRowGroup;
   10681           1 :         break;
   10682             :       case eTypeColGroup:
   10683           0 :         MOZ_CRASH("Colgroups should be suppresing non-col child items");
   10684             :       default:
   10685             :         NS_ASSERTION(ourParentType == eTypeBlock, "Unrecognized parent type");
   10686           1 :         if (IsRubyParentType(groupingParentType)) {
   10687             :           wrapperType = eTypeRuby;
   10688             :         } else {
   10689             :           NS_ASSERTION(IsTableParentType(groupingParentType),
   10690             :                        "groupingParentType should be either Ruby or table");
   10691           1 :           wrapperType = eTypeTable;
   10692             :         }
   10693             :     }
   10694             : 
   10695           1 :     nsStyleContext* parentStyle = aParentFrame->StyleContext();
   10696             :     WrapItemsInPseudoParent(aParentFrame->GetContent(), parentStyle,
   10697           1 :                             wrapperType, iter, endIter);
   10698             : 
   10699             :     // Now |iter| points to the item that was the first one we didn't wrap;
   10700             :     // loop and see whether we need to skip it or wrap it in something
   10701             :     // different.
   10702           1 :   } while (!iter.IsDone());
   10703             : }
   10704             : 
   10705             : /**
   10706             :  * This method wraps frame construction item from |aIter| to
   10707             :  * |aEndIter|. After it returns, aIter points to the first item
   10708             :  * after the wrapper.
   10709             :  */
   10710             : void
   10711           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::WrapItemsInPseudoParent(nsIContent* aParentContent,
   10712             :                                                nsStyleContext* aParentStyle,
   10713             :                                                ParentType aWrapperType,
   10714             :                                                FCItemIterator& aIter,
   10715             :                                                const FCItemIterator& aEndIter)
   10716             : {
   10717           1 :   const PseudoParentData& pseudoData = sPseudoParentData[aWrapperType];
   10718           1 :   nsIAtom* pseudoType = *pseudoData.mPseudoType;

   10722           1 :       (parentDisplay == StyleDisplay::Inline ||
   10723           1 :        parentDisplay == StyleDisplay::RubyBase ||
   10724             :        parentDisplay == StyleDisplay::RubyText)) {

   10777             : 
   10778           1 : void nsCSSFrameConstructor::CreateNeededPseudoSiblings(

   10818             : #ifdef DEBUG
   10819             : /**

   10828             : static bool
   10829             : FrameWantsToBeInAnonymousItem(const nsIFrame* aContainerFrame,

   10837             :   // an anonymous flex/grid item.

   10839             :     return true;

   10848             :   }
   10849             : 
   10850             :   return false;
   10851             : }
   10852             : #endif
   10853             : 
   10854             : static void
   10855             : VerifyGridFlexContainerChildren(nsIFrame* aParentFrame,
   10856             :                                 const nsFrameList& aChildren)
   10857             : {
   10858             : #ifdef DEBUG

   10881             : 
   10882             : inline void
   10883           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::ConstructFramesFromItemList(nsFrameConstructorState& aState,
   10884             :                                                    FrameConstructionItemList& aItems,
   10885             :                                                    nsContainerFrame* aParentFrame,
   10886             :                                                    nsFrameItems& aFrameItems)

   10890           1 :   CreateNeededPseudoInternalRubyBoxes(aState, aItems, aParentFrame);

   10892             :

   10895             :     NS_ASSERTION(iter.item().DesiredParentType() == GetParentType(aParentFrame),

   10904             : 
   10905             : void
   10906           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::AddFCItemsForAnonymousContent(
   10907             :             nsFrameConstructorState& aState,
   10908             :             nsContainerFrame* aFrame,
   10909             :             nsTArray<nsIAnonymousContentCreator::ContentInfo>& aAnonymousItems,
   10910             :             FrameConstructionItemList& aItemsToConstruct,
   10911             :             uint32_t aExtraFlags)
   10912             : {
   10913           1 :   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < aAnonymousItems.Length(); ++i) {
   10914           1 :     nsIContent* content = aAnonymousItems[i].mContent;
   10915             :     // Gecko-styled nodes should have no pending restyle flags.
   10916             :     MOZ_ASSERT_IF(!content->IsStyledByServo(),
   10917             :                   !content->IsElement() ||
   10918             :                   !(content->GetFlags() & ELEMENT_ALL_RESTYLE_FLAGS));
   10919             :     // Assert some things about this content
   10920             :     MOZ_ASSERT(!(content->GetFlags() &
   10921             :                  (NODE_DESCENDANTS_NEED_FRAMES | NODE_NEEDS_FRAME)),
   10922             :                "Should not be marked as needing frames");
   10923             :     MOZ_ASSERT(!content->GetPrimaryFrame(),
   10924             :                "Should have no existing frame");
   10925             :     MOZ_ASSERT(!content->IsNodeOfType(nsINode::eCOMMENT) &&
   10926             :                !content->IsNodeOfType(nsINode::ePROCESSING_INSTRUCTION),
   10927             :                "Why is someone creating garbage anonymous content");
   10928             : 
   10929             :     RefPtr<nsStyleContext> styleContext;
   10930             :     TreeMatchContext::AutoParentDisplayBasedStyleFixupSkipper
   10931           1 :       parentDisplayBasedStyleFixupSkipper(aState.mTreeMatchContext);
   10932             : 
   10933             :     // Make sure we eagerly performed the servo cascade when the anonymous
   10934             :     // nodes were created.
   10935             :     MOZ_ASSERT_IF(content->IsStyledByServo() && content->IsElement(),
   10936             :                   content->AsElement()->HasServoData());
   10937             : 
   10938             :     // Determine whether this NAC is pseudo-implementing.
   10939           1 :     nsIAtom* pseudo = nullptr;
   10940           1 :     if (content->IsElement()) {
   10941           1 :       auto pseudoType = content->AsElement()->GetPseudoElementType();
   10942           1 :       if (pseudoType != CSSPseudoElementType::NotPseudo) {
   10943           1 :         pseudo = nsCSSPseudoElements::GetPseudoAtom(pseudoType);
   10944             :       }
   10945             :     }
   10946             : 
   10947             :     // Determine the appropriate parent style for this NAC, and if the NAC
   10948             :     // implements a pseudo-element, the appropriate originating element
   10949             :     // (that is to say, the element to the left of the ::pseudo-element in
   10950             :     // the selector). This is all rather tricky, and merits some discussion.
   10951             :     //
   10952             :     // First, it's important to note that author stylesheets generally do not
   10953             :     // apply to elements in native-anonymous subtrees. The exceptions to
   10954             :     // this are web-exposed pseudo-elements, where authors can style the
   10955             :     // pseudo-implementing NAC if the originating element is not itself in a NAC
   10956             :     // subtree.
   10957             :     //
   10958             :     // For this reason, it's very important that we avoid using a style parent
   10959             :     // that is inside a NAC subtree together with an originating element that
   10960             :     // is not inside a NAC subtree, since that would allow authors to
   10961             :     // explicitly inherit styles from internal elements, potentially making
   10962             :     // the NAC hierarchy observable. To ensure this, and generally simplify
   10963             :     // things, we always set the originating element to the style parent.
   10964             :     //
   10965             :     // As a consequence of the above, all web-exposed pseudo-elements (which,
   10966             :     // by definition, must have a content-accessible originating element) must
   10967             :     // also inherit style from that same content-accessible element. To avoid
   10968             :     // unintuitive behavior differences between NAC elements that do and don't
   10969             :     // correspond to web-exposed pseudo-elements, we follow this protocol for
   10970             :     // all NAC, pseudo-implementing or not.
   10971             :     //
   10972             :     // However, things get tricky with the <video> element, where we have a
   10973             :     // bunch of XBL-generated anonymous content descending from a native-
   10974             :     // anonymous XULElement. The XBL elements inherit style from their
   10975             :     // flattened tree parent, because that's how XBL works. But then we need
   10976             :     // to figure out what to do when one of those anonymous XBL elements
   10977             :     // (like an <input> element) generates its own (possibly pseudo-element-
   10978             :     // implementing) NAC.
   10979             :     //
   10980             :     // In this case, we inherit style from the XBL-generated NAC-creating
   10981             :     // element, rather than the <video> element. There are a number of good
   10982             :     // reasons for this. First, inheriting from the great-grandparent while
   10983             :     // the parent inherits from the grandparent would be bizarre at best.
   10984             :     // Second, exposing pseudo-elements from elements within our particular
   10985             :     // XBL implementation would allow content styles to (un)intentionally
   10986             :     // alter the video controls, which would be very bad. Third, our UA
   10987             :     // stylesheets have selectors like:
   10988             :     //
   10989             :     // input[type=range][orient=horizontal]::-moz-range-track
   10990             :     //
   10991             :     // and we need to make sure that the originating element is the <input>,
   10992             :     // not the <video>, because that's where the |orient| attribute lives.
   10993             :     //
   10994             :     // The upshot of all of this is that, to find the style parent (and
   10995             :     // originating element, if applicable), we walk up our parent chain to the
   10996             :     // first element that is not itself NAC (distinct from whether it happens
   10997             :     // to be in a NAC subtree).
   10998             :     //
   10999             :     // The one exception to all of this is scrollbar content, which we parent
   11000             :     // directly to the scrollframe. This is because the special-snowflake
   11001             :     // construction of scroll frames doesn't result in the placeholder frame
   11002             :     // being constructed until later, which means that GetInFlowParent() doesn't
   11003             :     // work right in the case of out-of-flow scrollframes.
   11004             :     //
   11005             :     // To implement all this, we need to pass the correct parent style context
   11006             :     // here because SetPrimaryFrame() may not have been called on the content
   11007             :     // yet and thus ResolveStyleContext can't find it otherwise.
   11008             :     //
   11009             :     // We don't need to worry about display:contents here, because such
   11010             :     // elements don't get a frame and thus can't generate NAC. But we do need
   11011             :     // to worry about anonymous boxes, which CorrectStyleParentFrame handles
   11012             :     // for us.
   11013           1 :     nsIFrame* inheritFrame = aFrame;
   11014           1 :     if (!content->IsNativeScrollbarContent()) {
   11015           1 :       while (inheritFrame->GetContent()->IsNativeAnonymous()) {
   11016           1 :         inheritFrame = inheritFrame->GetInFlowParent();
   11017             :       }
   11018             :     }
   11019             : 
   11020             :     nsIFrame* styleParentFrame =
   11021           1 :       nsFrame::CorrectStyleParentFrame(inheritFrame, pseudo);
   11022             :     // The only way we can not have a style parent now is if inheritFrame is the
   11023             :     // canvas frame and we're the NAC parent for all the things added via
   11024             :     // nsIDocument::InsertAnonymousContent.
   11025             :     MOZ_ASSERT_IF(!styleParentFrame,
   11026             :                   inheritFrame->GetType() == nsGkAtoms::canvasFrame);
   11027             :     // And that anonymous div has no pseudo.
   11028             :     MOZ_ASSERT_IF(!styleParentFrame, !pseudo);
   11029             : 
   11030             :     Element* originating =
   11031           1 :       pseudo ? styleParentFrame->GetContent()->AsElement() : nullptr;
   11032             :     nsStyleContext* parentStyle =
   11033           1 :       styleParentFrame ? styleParentFrame->StyleContext() : nullptr;
   11034           1 :     styleContext =
   11035           1 :       ResolveStyleContext(parentStyle, content, &aState, originating);
   11036             : 
   11037           1 :     nsTArray<nsIAnonymousContentCreator::ContentInfo>* anonChildren = nullptr;
   11038           1 :     if (!aAnonymousItems[i].mChildren.IsEmpty()) {
   11039           1 :       anonChildren = &aAnonymousItems[i].mChildren;
   11040             :     }
   11041             : 
   11042             :     uint32_t flags = ITEM_ALLOW_XBL_BASE | ITEM_ALLOW_PAGE_BREAK |
   11043           1 :                      ITEM_IS_ANONYMOUSCONTENTCREATOR_CONTENT | aExtraFlags;
   11044             : 
   11045             :     AddFrameConstructionItemsInternal(aState, content, aFrame,
   11046             :                                       content->NodeInfo()->NameAtom(),
   11047             :                                       content->GetNameSpaceID(),
   11048             :                                       true, styleContext, flags,
   11049           1 :                                       anonChildren, aItemsToConstruct);
   11050           1 :   }
   11051           1 : }
   11052             : 
   11053             : void
   11054           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::ProcessChildren(nsFrameConstructorState& aState,
   11055             :                                        nsIContent*              aContent,
   11056             :                                        nsStyleContext*          aStyleContext,
   11057             :                                        nsContainerFrame*        aFrame,
   11058             :                                        const bool               aCanHaveGeneratedContent,
   11059             :                                        nsFrameItems&            aFrameItems,
   11060             :                                        const bool               aAllowBlockStyles,
   11061             :                                        PendingBinding*          aPendingBinding,
   11062             :                                        nsIFrame*                aPossiblyLeafFrame)
   11063             : {
   11064             :   NS_PRECONDITION(aFrame, "Must have parent frame here");
   11065             :   NS_PRECONDITION(aFrame->GetContentInsertionFrame() == aFrame,
   11066             :                   "Parent frame in ProcessChildren should be its own "
   11067             :                   "content insertion frame");
   11068           1 :   const uint32_t kMaxDepth = 2 * MAX_REFLOW_DEPTH;
   11069             :   static_assert(kMaxDepth <= UINT16_MAX, "mCurrentDepth type is too narrow");
   11070           1 :   AutoRestore<uint16_t> savedDepth(mCurrentDepth);
   11071           1 :   if (mCurrentDepth != UINT16_MAX) {
   11072           1 :     ++mCurrentDepth;
   11073             :   }
   11074             : 
   11075           1 :   if (!aPossiblyLeafFrame) {
   11076           1 :     aPossiblyLeafFrame = aFrame;
   11077             :   }
   11078             : 
   11079             :   // XXXbz ideally, this would do all the pushing of various
   11080             :   // containing blocks as needed, so callers don't have to do it...
   11081             : 
   11082           1 :   bool haveFirstLetterStyle = false, haveFirstLineStyle = false;
   11083           1 :   if (aAllowBlockStyles) {
   11084             :     ShouldHaveSpecialBlockStyle(aContent, aStyleContext, &haveFirstLetterStyle,
   11085           1 :                                 &haveFirstLineStyle);
   11086             :   }
   11087             : 
   11088           1 :   const bool isFlexOrGridContainer = ::IsFlexOrGridContainer(aFrame);

   11272             : // Support for :first-line style
   11273             : 
   11274             : // Special routine to handle placing a list of frames into a block
   11275             : // frame that has first-line style. The routine ensures that the first
   11276             : // collection of inline frames end up in a first-line frame.
   11277             : // NOTE: aState may have containing block information related to a
   11278             : // different part of the frame tree than where the first line occurs.
   11279             : // In particular aState may be set up for where ContentInserted or
   11280             : // ContentAppended is inserting content, which may be some
   11281             : // non-first-in-flow continuation of the block to which the first-line
   11282             : // belongs. So this function needs to be careful about how it uses
   11283             : // aState.
   11284             : void
   11285           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::WrapFramesInFirstLineFrame(
   11286             :   nsFrameConstructorState& aState,
   11287             :   nsIContent*              aBlockContent,
   11288             :   nsContainerFrame*        aBlockFrame,
   11289             :   nsFirstLineFrame*        aLineFrame,
   11290             :   nsFrameItems&            aFrameItems)
   11291             : {
   11292             :   // Find the part of aFrameItems that we want to put in the first-line
   11293           1 :   nsFrameList::FrameLinkEnumerator link(aFrameItems);
   11294           1 :   while (!link.AtEnd() && link.NextFrame()->IsInlineOutside()) {
   11295           1 :     link.Next();

   11297             : 
   11298           1 :   nsFrameList firstLineChildren = aFrameItems.ExtractHead(link);
   11299             : 
   11300           1 :   if (firstLineChildren.IsEmpty()) {
   11301             :     // Nothing is supposed to go into the first-line; nothing to do
   11302           0 :     return;
   11303             :   }
   11304             : 
   11305           1 :   if (!aLineFrame) {
   11306             :     // Create line frame
   11307             :     nsStyleContext* parentStyle =
   11308             :       nsFrame::CorrectStyleParentFrame(aBlockFrame,
   11309             :                                        nsCSSPseudoElements::firstLine)->
   11310           1 :         StyleContext();

   11516             : //----------------------------------------------------------------------
   11517             : 
   11518             : // First-letter support
   11519             : 
   11520             : // Determine how many characters in the text fragment apply to the
   11521             : // first letter
   11522             : static int32_t
   11523           1 : FirstLetterCount(const nsTextFragment* aFragment)
   11524             : {
   11525           1 :   int32_t count = 0;
   11526           1 :   int32_t firstLetterLength = 0;
   11527             : 
   11528           1 :   int32_t i, n = aFragment->GetLength();
   11529           1 :   for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
   11530           1 :     char16_t ch = aFragment->CharAt(i);
   11531             :     // FIXME: take content language into account when deciding whitespace.
   11532           1 :     if (dom::IsSpaceCharacter(ch)) {
   11533           1 :       if (firstLetterLength) {
   11534             :         break;
   11535             :       }
   11536           1 :       count++;
   11537           1 :       continue;
   11538             :     }
   11539             :     // XXX I18n
   11540           1 :     if ((ch == '\'') || (ch == '\"')) {
   11541           0 :       if (firstLetterLength) {
   11542             :         break;
   11543             :       }
   11544             :       // keep looping
   11545             :       firstLetterLength = 1;
   11546             :     }
   11547             :     else {
   11548           1 :       count++;
   11549           1 :       break;
   11550             :     }
   11551             :   }
   11552             : 
   11553           1 :   return count;
   11554             : }
   11555             : 
   11556             : static bool
   11557           1 : NeedFirstLetterContinuation(nsIContent* aContent)
   11558             : {

   11568           1 :         result = true;
   11569             :       }
   11570             :     }
   11571             :   }
   11572           1 :   return result;
   11573             : }

   11576             : {

   11768             : void
   11769           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::WrapFramesInFirstLetterFrame(
   11770             :   nsContainerFrame*        aBlockFrame,
   11771             :   nsContainerFrame*        aBlockContinuation,
   11772             :   nsContainerFrame*        aParentFrame,
   11773             :   nsIFrame*                aParentFrameList,
   11774             :   nsContainerFrame**       aModifiedParent,
   11775             :   nsIFrame**               aTextFrame,
   11776             :   nsIFrame**               aPrevFrame,
   11777             :   nsFrameItems&            aLetterFrames,
   11778             :   bool*                    aStopLooking)
   11779             : {
   11780           1 :   nsIFrame* prevFrame = nullptr;
   11781           1 :   nsIFrame* frame = aParentFrameList;
   11782             : 
   11783           1 :   while (frame) {
   11784           1 :     nsIFrame* nextFrame = frame->GetNextSibling();
   11785             : 
   11786           1 :     nsIAtom* frameType = frame->GetType();

   11802             :     }

   11806             :                                    static_cast<nsContainerFrame*>(frame),

   11812             :     }

   11814             :       // This will stop us looking to create more letter frames. For
   11815             :       // example, maybe the frame-type is "letterFrame" or
   11816             :       // "placeholderFrame". This keeps us from creating extra letter

   11825           1 :     frame = nextFrame;

   12024             : 
   12025             : // Fixup the letter frame situation for the given block
   12026             : void
   12027           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::RecoverLetterFrames(nsContainerFrame* aBlockFrame)
   12028             : {
   12029             :   aBlockFrame =
   12030           1 :     static_cast<nsContainerFrame*>(aBlockFrame->FirstContinuation());
   12031           1 :   nsContainerFrame* continuation = aBlockFrame;
   12032             : 
   12033           1 :   nsContainerFrame* parentFrame = nullptr;
   12034           1 :   nsIFrame* textFrame = nullptr;
   12035           1 :   nsIFrame* prevFrame = nullptr;
   12036             :   nsFrameItems letterFrames;
   12037           1 :   bool stopLooking = false;
   12038           1 :   do {
   12039             :     // XXX shouldn't this bit be set already (bug 408493), assert instead?
   12040           1 :     continuation->AddStateBits(NS_BLOCK_HAS_FIRST_LETTER_STYLE);
   12041             :     WrapFramesInFirstLetterFrame(aBlockFrame, continuation, continuation,
   12042           1 :                                  continuation->PrincipalChildList().FirstChild(),
   12043             :                                  &parentFrame, &textFrame, &prevFrame,
   12044           1 :                                  letterFrames, &stopLooking);
   12045           1 :     if (stopLooking) {
   12046             :       break;
   12047             :     }
   12048             :     continuation =
   12049           1 :       static_cast<nsContainerFrame*>(continuation->GetNextContinuation());
   12050             :   } while (continuation);
   12051             : 
   12052           1 :   if (parentFrame) {
   12053             :     // Take the old textFrame out of the parents child list
   12054           0 :     RemoveFrame(kPrincipalList, textFrame);
   12055             : 
   12056             :     // Insert in the letter frame(s)
   12057           0 :     parentFrame->InsertFrames(kPrincipalList, prevFrame, letterFrames);
   12058             :   }
   12059           1 : }
   12060             : 
   12061             : //----------------------------------------------------------------------
   12062             : 
   12063             : // listbox Widget Routines
   12064             : 
   12065             : void

   12135             : //----------------------------------------
   12136             : 
   12137             : void
   12138           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::ConstructBlock(nsFrameConstructorState& aState,
   12139             :                                       nsIContent*              aContent,

   12180             :                   aContentParentFrame ? aContentParentFrame :
   12181           1 :                                         aParentFrame);

   12184             :     // Set mRootElementFrame before processing children.
   12185           1 :     mRootElementFrame = *aNewFrame;
   12186             :   }

   12188             :   // We should make the outer frame be the absolute containing block,
   12189             :   // if one is required. We have to do this because absolute
   12190             :   // positioning must be computed with respect to the CSS dimensions
   12191             :   // of the element, which are the dimensions of the outer block. But

   12210             : 
   12211             : nsIFrame*
   12212           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::ConstructInline(nsFrameConstructorState& aState,
   12213             :                                        FrameConstructionItem&   aItem,
   12214             :                                        nsContainerFrame*        aParentFrame,
   12215             :                                        const nsStyleDisplay*    aDisplay,
   12216             :                                        nsFrameItems&            aFrameItems)
   12217             : {
   12218             :   // If an inline frame has non-inline kids, then we chop up the child list
   12219             :   // into runs of blocks and runs of inlines, create anonymous block frames to
   12220             :   // contain the runs of blocks, inline frames with our style context for the
   12221             :   // runs of inlines, and put all these frames, in order, into aFrameItems.  We
   12222             :   // return the the first one.  The whole setup is called an {ib}
   12223             :   // split; in what follows "frames in the split" refers to the anonymous blocks
   12224             :   // and inlines that contain our children.
   12225             :   //
   12226             :   // {ib} splits maintain the following invariants:
   12227             :   // 1) All frames in the split have the NS_FRAME_PART_OF_IBSPLIT bit
   12228             :   //    set.
   12229             :   // 2) Each frame in the split has the nsIFrame::IBSplitSibling
   12230             :   //    property pointing to the next frame in the split, except for the last
   12231             :   //    one, which does not have it set.
   12232             :   // 3) Each frame in the split has the nsIFrame::IBSplitPrevSibling
   12233             :   //    property pointing to the previous frame in the split, except for the
   12234             :   //    first one, which does not have it set.
   12235             :   // 4) The first and last frame in the split are always inlines.
   12236             :   //
   12237             :   // An invariant that is NOT maintained is that the wrappers are actually
   12238             :   // linked via GetNextSibling linkage.  A simple example is an inline
   12239             :   // containing an inline that contains a block.  The three parts of the inner
   12240             :   // inline end up with three different parents.
   12241             :   //
   12242             :   // For example, this HTML:
   12243             :   // <span>
   12244             :   //   <div>a</div>
   12245             :   //   <span>
   12246             :   //     b
   12247             :   //     <div>c</div>
   12248             :   //   </span>
   12249             :   //   d
   12250             :   //   <div>e</div>
   12251             :   //   f
   12252             :   //  </span>
   12253             :   // Gives the following frame tree:
   12254             :   //
   12255             :   // Inline (outer span)
   12256             :   // Block (anonymous, outer span)
   12257             :   //   Block (div)
   12258             :   //     Text("a")
   12259             :   // Inline (outer span)
   12260             :   //   Inline (inner span)
   12261             :   //     Text("b")
   12262             :   // Block (anonymous, outer span)
   12263             :   //   Block (anonymous, inner span)
   12264             :   //     Block (div)
   12265             :   //       Text("c")
   12266             :   // Inline (outer span)
   12267             :   //   Inline (inner span)
   12268             :   //   Text("d")
   12269             :   // Block (anonymous, outer span)
   12270             :   //   Block (div)
   12271             :   //     Text("e")
   12272             :   // Inline (outer span)
   12273             :   //   Text("f")
   12274             : 
   12275           1 :   nsIContent* const content = aItem.mContent;
   12276           1 :   nsStyleContext* const styleContext = aItem.mStyleContext;
   12277             : 
   12278             :   bool positioned =
   12279           1 :     StyleDisplay::Inline == aDisplay->mDisplay &&
   12280           1 :     aDisplay->IsRelativelyPositionedStyle() &&
   12281           1 :     !nsSVGUtils::IsInSVGTextSubtree(aParentFrame);
   12282             : 
   12283           1 :   nsInlineFrame* newFrame = NS_NewInlineFrame(mPresShell, styleContext);
   12284             : 
   12285             :   // Initialize the frame
   12286           1 :   InitAndRestoreFrame(aState, content, aParentFrame, newFrame);
   12287             : 
   12288             :   // Inline frames can always have generated content
   12289           1 :   newFrame->AddStateBits(NS_FRAME_MAY_HAVE_GENERATED_CONTENT);
   12290             : 
   12291           1 :   nsFrameConstructorSaveState absoluteSaveState;  // definition cannot be inside next block
   12292             :                                                   // because the object's destructor is significant
   12293             :                                                   // this is part of the fix for bug 42372
   12294             : 
   12295           1 :   newFrame->AddStateBits(NS_FRAME_CAN_HAVE_ABSPOS_CHILDREN);
   12296           1 :   if (positioned) {
   12297             :     // Relatively positioned frames becomes a container for child
   12298             :     // frames that are positioned
   12299           1 :     aState.PushAbsoluteContainingBlock(newFrame, newFrame, absoluteSaveState);
   12300             :   }
   12301             : 
   12302             :   // Process the child content
   12303             :   nsFrameItems childItems;
   12304           1 :   ConstructFramesFromItemList(aState, aItem.mChildItems, newFrame, childItems);
   12305             : 
   12306             :   nsFrameList::FrameLinkEnumerator firstBlockEnumerator(childItems);
   12307           1 :   if (!aItem.mIsAllInline) {
   12308           1 :     FindFirstBlock(firstBlockEnumerator);
   12309             :   }
   12310             : 
   12311           1 :   if (aItem.mIsAllInline || firstBlockEnumerator.AtEnd()) {
   12312             :     // This part is easy.  We either already know we have no non-inline kids,
   12313             :     // or haven't found any when constructing actual frames (the latter can
   12314             :     // happen only if out-of-flows that we thought had no containing block
   12315             :     // acquired one when ancestor inline frames and {ib} splits got
   12316             :     // constructed).  Just put all the kids into the single inline frame and
   12317             :     // bail.
   12318           1 :     newFrame->SetInitialChildList(kPrincipalList, childItems);
   12319           1 :     aState.AddChild(newFrame, aFrameItems, content, styleContext, aParentFrame);
   12320           1 :     return newFrame;
   12321             :   }
   12322             : 
   12323             :   // This inline frame contains several types of children. Therefore this frame
   12324             :   // has to be chopped into several pieces, as described above.
   12325             : 
   12326             :   // Grab the first inline's kids
   12327           1 :   nsFrameList firstInlineKids = childItems.ExtractHead(firstBlockEnumerator);
   12328           1 :   newFrame->SetInitialChildList(kPrincipalList, firstInlineKids);
   12329             : 
   12330           1 :   aFrameItems.AddChild(newFrame);
   12331             : 
   12332           1 :   newFrame->AddStateBits(NS_FRAME_OWNS_ANON_BOXES);
   12333           1 :   CreateIBSiblings(aState, newFrame, positioned, childItems, aFrameItems);
   12334             : 
   12335           1 :   return newFrame;
   12336             : }
   12337             : 
   12338             : void
   12339           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::CreateIBSiblings(nsFrameConstructorState& aState,
   12340             :                                         nsContainerFrame* aInitialInline,
   12341             :                                         bool aIsPositioned,
   12342             :                                         nsFrameItems& aChildItems,
   12343             :                                         nsFrameItems& aSiblings)
   12344             : {
   12345           1 :   nsIContent* content = aInitialInline->GetContent();
   12346           1 :   nsStyleContext* styleContext = aInitialInline->StyleContext();
   12347           1 :   nsContainerFrame* parentFrame = aInitialInline->GetParent();
   12348             : 
   12349             :   // Resolve the right style context for our anonymous blocks.
   12350             :   // The distinction in styles is needed because of CSS 2.1, section
   12351             :   // 9.2.1.1, which says:
   12352             :   //   When such an inline box is affected by relative positioning, any
   12353             :   //   resulting translation also affects the block-level box contained
   12354             :   //   in the inline box.
   12355             :   RefPtr<nsStyleContext> blockSC = mPresShell->StyleSet()->
   12356             :     ResolveInheritingAnonymousBoxStyle(nsCSSAnonBoxes::mozBlockInsideInlineWrapper,
   12357           1 :                                        styleContext);
   12358             : 
   12359             :   nsContainerFrame* lastNewInline =
   12360           1 :     static_cast<nsContainerFrame*>(aInitialInline->FirstContinuation());
   12361           1 :   do {
   12362             :     // On entry to this loop aChildItems is not empty and the first frame in it
   12363             :     // is block-level.
   12364             :     NS_PRECONDITION(aChildItems.NotEmpty(), "Should have child items");
   12365             :     NS_PRECONDITION(!aChildItems.FirstChild()->IsInlineOutside(),
   12366             :                     "Must have list starting with block");
   12367             : 
   12368             :     // The initial run of blocks belongs to an anonymous block that we create
   12369             :     // right now. The anonymous block will be the parent of these block
   12370             :     // children of the inline.
   12371           1 :     nsBlockFrame* blockFrame = NS_NewBlockFrame(mPresShell, blockSC);
   12372           1 :     InitAndRestoreFrame(aState, content, parentFrame, blockFrame, false);
   12373             : 
   12374             :     // Find the first non-block child which defines the end of our block kids
   12375             :     // and the start of our next inline's kids
   12376             :     nsFrameList::FrameLinkEnumerator firstNonBlock =
   12377           1 :       FindFirstNonBlock(aChildItems);
   12378           1 :     nsFrameList blockKids = aChildItems.ExtractHead(firstNonBlock);
   12379             : 
   12380           1 :     MoveChildrenTo(aInitialInline, blockFrame, blockKids);
   12381             : 
   12382           1 :     SetFrameIsIBSplit(lastNewInline, blockFrame);
   12383           1 :     aSiblings.AddChild(blockFrame);
   12384             : 
   12385             :     // Now grab the initial inlines in aChildItems and put them into an inline
   12386             :     // frame.
   12387           1 :     nsInlineFrame* inlineFrame = NS_NewInlineFrame(mPresShell, styleContext);
   12388           1 :     InitAndRestoreFrame(aState, content, parentFrame, inlineFrame, false);
   12389             :     inlineFrame->AddStateBits(NS_FRAME_MAY_HAVE_GENERATED_CONTENT |
   12390           1 :                               NS_FRAME_CAN_HAVE_ABSPOS_CHILDREN);
   12391           1 :     if (aIsPositioned) {
   12392           0 :       inlineFrame->MarkAsAbsoluteContainingBlock();
   12393             :     }
   12394             : 
   12395           1 :     if (aChildItems.NotEmpty()) {
   12396           1 :       nsFrameList::FrameLinkEnumerator firstBlock(aChildItems);
   12397           1 :       FindFirstBlock(firstBlock);
   12398           1 :       nsFrameList inlineKids = aChildItems.ExtractHead(firstBlock);
   12399             : 
   12400           1 :       MoveChildrenTo(aInitialInline, inlineFrame, inlineKids);
   12401             :     }
   12402             : 
   12403           1 :     SetFrameIsIBSplit(blockFrame, inlineFrame);
   12404           1 :     aSiblings.AddChild(inlineFrame);
   12405           1 :     lastNewInline = inlineFrame;
   12406           1 :   } while (aChildItems.NotEmpty());
   12407             : 
   12408           1 :   SetFrameIsIBSplit(lastNewInline, nullptr);
   12409           1 : }
   12410             : 
   12411             : void
   12412           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::BuildInlineChildItems(nsFrameConstructorState& aState,
   12413             :                                              FrameConstructionItem& aParentItem,
   12414             :                                              bool aItemIsWithinSVGText,
   12415             :                                              bool aItemAllowsTextPathChild)
   12416             : {

   12456           1 :     FlattenedChildIterator iter(parentContent);
   12457           1 :     for (nsIContent* content = iter.GetNextChild(); content; content = iter.GetNextChild()) {

   12459             :       // (if the content is a children element then contentParent != parentContent because the

   12461             :       // for default content). Push the children element as an ancestor here because
   12462             :       // it does not have a frame and would not otherwise be pushed as an ancestor.
   12463           1 :       nsIContent* contentParent = content->GetParent();

   12470           0 :           insertionPointPusher.PushStyleScope(contentParent->AsElement());
   12471             :         }

   12473             : 
   12474             :       // Manually check for comments/PIs, since we don't have a frame to pass to

   12476             :       // so there is no need to do the NeedFrameFor check.
   12477           1 :       content->UnsetFlags(NODE_DESCENDANTS_NEED_FRAMES | NODE_NEEDS_FRAME);

   12490           1 :         ResolveStyleContext(parentStyleContext, content, &aState);
   12491             :

   12493             :                                         content->NodeInfo()->NameAtom(),

   12496             :                                         flags, nullptr,

   12500             : 
   12501           1 :   if (!aItemIsWithinSVGText) {
   12502             :     // Probe for generated content after
   12503             :     CreateGeneratedContentItem(aState, nullptr, parentContent, parentStyleContext,
   12504             :                                CSSPseudoElementType::after,
   12505           1 :                                aParentItem.mChildItems);
   12506             :   }
   12507             : 
   12508           1 :   aParentItem.mIsAllInline = aParentItem.mChildItems.AreAllItemsInline();
   12509           1 : }
   12510             : 
   12511             : // return whether it's ok to append (in the AppendFrames sense) to
   12512             : // aParentFrame if our nextSibling is aNextSibling.  aParentFrame must
   12513             : // be an ib-split inline.

   12626             :   // Situation #4 is a ruby-related frame that's getting new children.
   12627             :   // The situation for ruby is complex, especially when interacting with
   12628             :   // spaces. It containes these two special cases apart from tables:
   12629             :   // 1) There are effectively three types of white spaces in ruby frames
   12630             :   //    we handle differently: leading/tailing/inter-level space,
   12631             :   //    inter-base/inter-annotation space, and inter-segment space.
   12632             :   //    These three types of spaces can be converted to each other when
   12633             :   //    their sibling changes.
   12634             :   // 2) The first effective child of a ruby frame must always be a ruby
   12635             :   //    base container. It should be created or destroyed accordingly.
   12636           1 :   if (IsRubyPseudo(aFrame) ||
   12637           1 :       frameType == nsGkAtoms::rubyFrame ||

   12639             :     // We want to optimize it better, and avoid reframing as much as

   12641             :     // usually won't be very large, it should be fine to reframe it.
   12642             :     RecreateFramesForContent(aFrame->GetContent(), true,
   12643           1 :                              REMOVE_FOR_RECONSTRUCTION, nullptr);
   12644           1 :     return true;
   12645             :   }
   12646             : 
   12647             :   // Situation #5 is a case when table pseudo-frames don't work out right
   12648           1 :   ParentType parentType = GetParentType(aFrame);
   12649             :   // If all the kids want a parent of the type that aFrame is, then we're all
   12650             :   // set to go.  Indeed, there won't be any table pseudo-frames created between
   12651             :   // aFrame and the kids, so those won't need to be merged with any table
   12652             :   // pseudo-frames that might already be kids of aFrame.  If aFrame itself is a
   12653             :   // table pseudo-frame, then all the kids in this list would have wanted a
   12654             :   // frame of that type wrapping them anyway, so putting them inside it is ok.
   12655           1 :   if (!aItems.AllWantParentType(parentType)) {
   12656             :     // Don't give up yet.  If parentType is not eTypeBlock and the parent is
   12657             :     // not a generated content frame, then try filtering whitespace out of the
   12658             :     // list.
   12659           1 :     if (parentType != eTypeBlock && !aFrame->IsGeneratedContentFrame()) {
   12660             :       // For leading whitespace followed by a kid that wants our parent type,
   12661             :       // there are four cases:
   12662             :       // 1) We have a previous sibling which is not a table pseudo.  That means
   12663             :       //    that previous sibling wanted a (non-block) parent of the type we're
   12664             :       //    looking at.  Then the whitespace comes between two table-internal
   12665             :       //    elements, so should be collapsed out.
   12666             :       // 2) We have a previous sibling which is a table pseudo.  It might have
   12667             :       //    kids who want this whitespace, so we need to reframe.
   12668             :       // 3) We have no previous sibling and our parent frame is not a table
   12669             :       //    pseudo.  That means that we'll be at the beginning of our actual
   12670             :       //    non-block-type parent, and the whitespace is OK to collapse out.
   12671             :       //    If something is ever inserted before us, it'll find our own parent
   12672             :       //    as its parent and if it's something that would care about the
   12673             :       //    whitespace it'll want a block parent, so it'll trigger a reframe at
   12674             :       //    that point.
   12675             :       // 4) We have no previous sibling and our parent frame is a table pseudo.
   12676             :       //    Need to reframe.
   12677             :       // All that is predicated on finding the correct previous sibling.  We
   12678             :       // might have to walk backwards along continuations from aFrame to do so.
   12679             :       //
   12680             :       // It's always OK to drop whitespace between any two items that want a
   12681             :       // parent of type parentType.
   12682             :       //
   12683             :       // For trailing whitespace preceded by a kid that wants our parent type,
   12684             :       // there are four cases:
   12685             :       // 1) We have a next sibling which is not a table pseudo.  That means
   12686             :       //    that next sibling wanted a (non-block) parent of the type we're
   12687             :       //    looking at.  Then the whitespace comes between two table-internal
   12688             :       //    elements, so should be collapsed out.
   12689             :       // 2) We have a next sibling which is a table pseudo.  It might have
   12690             :       //    kids who want this whitespace, so we need to reframe.
   12691             :       // 3) We have no next sibling and our parent frame is not a table
   12692             :       //    pseudo.  That means that we'll be at the end of our actual
   12693             :       //    non-block-type parent, and the whitespace is OK to collapse out.

   12695             :       //    as its parent and if it's something that would care about the
   12696             :       //    whitespace it'll want a block parent, so it'll trigger a reframe at
   12697             :       //    that point.
   12698             :       // 4) We have no next sibling and our parent frame is a table pseudo.
   12699             :       //    Need to reframe.

   12701             :       // have to walk forward along continuations from aFrame to do so.  That

   12903             : void
   12904           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::ReframeContainingBlock(nsIFrame*    aFrame,
   12905             :                                               RemoveFlags  aFlags,
   12906             :                                               nsIContent** aDestroyedFramesFor)
   12907             : {
   12908             : 
   12909             : #ifdef DEBUG
   12910             :   // ReframeContainingBlock is a NASTY routine, it causes terrible performance problems
   12911             :   // so I want to see when it is happening!  Unfortunately, it is happening way to often because
   12912             :   // so much content on the web causes block-in-inline frame situations and we handle them
   12913             :   // very poorly
   12914             :   if (gNoisyContentUpdates) {
   12915             :     printf("nsCSSFrameConstructor::ReframeContainingBlock frame=%p\n",
   12916             :            static_cast<void*>(aFrame));
   12917             :   }
   12918             : #endif
   12919             : 
   12920             :   // XXXbz how exactly would we get here while isReflowing anyway?  Should this
   12921             :   // whole test be ifdef DEBUG?
   12922           1 :   if (mPresShell->IsReflowLocked()) {
   12923             :     // don't ReframeContainingBlock, this will result in a crash
   12924             :     // if we remove a tree that's in reflow - see bug 121368 for testcase

   12930           1 :   nsIFrame* containingBlock = GetIBContainingBlockFor(aFrame);

   12958             : void
   12959           1 : nsCSSFrameConstructor::GenerateChildFrames(nsContainerFrame* aFrame)
   12960             : {
